Ella trabaja en su casa, en la parte de entrada coloco anaqueles y estantería que ahora vende entre sus vecinos. Esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$475 para invertir en mercancías, piensa que lo puede pagar en 6 meses. Comenta que al comprar mercancía de contado pueden mejorarle el precio así ella obtendrá más ganancia y con esto poder seguir abasteciéndose.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.en:
I’m the owner of a small store called M., located in a room in my home, in one of the most popular areas in my community. I’ve opened it a year ago. I hope to make my business grow, and that’s why I need to provide new and more products since this is what my clients are requesting. With my income I have been able to help my family. My goal is to continue to support my children’s education.

Loan Use: Purchase bread, coffee, sugar, milk, eggs, soft drinks, and others.

Soy propietario de una pequeña pulperia llamada M., ubicada en mi casa de habitacion en una las zonas mas conocidas de mi comunidad. Tengo 1 año de tenerlo operando, mi deseo es hacer crecer mi negocio mucho mas, por lo que necesito abastecer mi pulperia con nuevos productos, variados ya que mis clientes piden les de algo nuevo. Con las ingresos que percibo de mis ventas he podido ayudar a mi familia, mi meta es poder seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de pan, cafe, azucar, leche, huevos, refrescos y otros.

loans.name: Nelson David

texts.en:
My name is Nelson David and in my community I am very well known for my sale of sweet ice cream. My business is located near the catholic church in my city. I've been selling ice cream for 4 years and it has generated income to support my family. My children help me to sell in other neighboring communities. Now is the time when sales increase and I need to be able to cover the demand of my clients. This loan will help me get to that point.

SPANISH

Me llamo Nelson David y en mi comunidad soy bastante conocido por mi rica venta de helados, mi negocio esta ubicado en la parte de atras de la iglesia catolica en mi ciudad. Tengo cuatro años de tener mi venta de helados que me ha generado ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mis hijos me ayudan a vender en otras comunidades vecinas en sus ratos libres, ahora que es epoca de calor mis ventas aumentan y necesito poder cubrir la demanda de mis clientes.

loans.use: Sorbetes, ice cream, servilletas, vasos desechables.

loans.name: Heberto

texts.en:
My name is Heberto S., and I sell vegetables. I have a stand that I use to distribute in different small towns in the area of my community. I’ve been in this type of activity for a year. I’ve been able to provide an education for my children, and to pay for my family’s expenses. I am a single parent, and when my children are free, they help me distribute the vegetables.

Loan Use: Purchase tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, cabbage, cucumbers, and others.

Mi nombre es Heberto S., cuento con un negocio de venta de Verduras ambulantes los que distribuyo en varias aldeas aledañas a mi comunidad. Tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, con el que he podido ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y gastos familiares, soy padre soltero y en ratos libres mi hijos me colaboran en la distribucion del producto.

loans.use: Compra de tomates, chiles,cebollas, repollos,pepino y otros

loans.name: Marlon Francisco

texts.en:
My name the Marlon Francisco, I have a business of clothes used located in the central part of this city. I've been selling clothes for several years so that I can pay for my childrens' education. Right now, I could use the loan for transportation so that I can get to neighboring towns to sell my clothes there. This will help me generate the profits I need to pay back the loan.

SPANISH

Mi nombre el Marlon Francisco, tengo un negocio de ropa usada ubicado en la parte central y mas transitable en esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad. Con la que podido dar educacion a mis hijos, en este momento necesito vender mas para poder comprar mi propio carro y visitar otras comunidades y lograr mayores ingresos en mis ventas.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa usada clasificada

payments.comment: Gracias por su ayuda, mis ventas mejoraron por la calidad de ropa que pude comprar, ahora pienso comprar y surtir el negocio para mejorar mis ingresos mas... Gracias!!!

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a married housewife and has three children. Her husband is a bricklayer and both of them decided to start a business because they always wished to be independent. Because of this, they began to sell tacos 5 years ago.

Olivia prepares the food and her husband and sons helps her with the clients and sometimes with home delivery. She is very happy because her business is growing little by little and she wants to grow a little bit more. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of US$475 to purchase merchandise because she wants to prepare dinners for holy days and Christmas and she needs to be prepared. If she is able to obtain the loan, she could take advantage of the season with more sales and better income for her and her family.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Olivia es una ama de casa, con 3 hijos y casada, su esposo es obrero y entre los 2 convinieron en poner un negocio, pues siempre han acariciado la idea de ser independientes, por eso desde hace 5 años iniciaron la venta de Tacos. Doña Olivia se encarga de la elaboración de alimentos y entre sus hijos y su esposo en sus ratos libres la apoyan con la atención de clientes y entrega de pedidos a domicilio. Esta muy contenta pues cada vez es mayor su clientela llegando a comprar clientes de otras colonias. Desea hacer crecer su negocio por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 a 6 meses, para invertir en mercancías, tiene pensado preparar banquetes escolares para las posadas navideñas y necesita estar preparada para ello. De obtener el apoyo, podrá aprovechar la temporada navideña, con mayores ventas y mejores ganancias para ella y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.en:
My name is Reyna Cristina, I have a store where I sell clothes and shoes. It’s located in one of the busiest neighborhoods in the city. I have several years in this type of activity. With the income I am able to provide my children with education and pay for the family’s expenses. I’d like to stock up my store since Christmas is coming up, and in this season sales are a lot higher.

Loan Use: Purchase clothes, shoes, and beauty products.

Mi Nombre es ReYna Cristina, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado,ubicado en uno de los barrios mas transitados de esta ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para dar educacion a mis hijos y cubrir los gastos familiares, deseo surtir bien mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad en es la epoca de mayor venta

loans.use: Compra de Ropa, Calzado y Productos de Belleza

payments.comment: Gracias a su ayuda, mejore mis ingresos, espero poder contar nuevamente con la ayuda que me brindaron...

loans.name: Dilcia Maria

texts.en:
My name is Dilcia. My store is usually busy. Especially now that Christmas is coming up, my neighbors and clients come see me so I make new clothes for the entire family. I’ve had my workshop in a room in my home for five years, and I have a store en my city’s market. With my income, I can help my family with their expenses and education. Since last month, I’ve hired a girl to help me finish the clothes that I make for my clients. I hope to have a variety of colorful fabrics, so I can get more clients and sell more.

Loan Use: Purchase threads, zippers, pins, fabrics, buttons, lace, and others.

Mi nombre es Dilcia y mi negocio es bastante visitado y mas ahora que se acerca la navidad, mis vecinos y clientes me buscan desde antes para que les confeccione los estrenos de toda la familia. Tengo cinco años de tener mi taller en mi casa de habitacion, y tengo una sucursal en el mercado Popular de mi ciudad. Con los ingresos que percibo puedo apoyar a mi famiia con sus gastos y estudios. Tengo 1 mes de haber contratado a una muchacha que me ayuda a terminar las confecciones de mis clientes, espero poder tener variedad de telas de colores alegres para que las personas me busquen y poder vender mas.

loans.use: Compra de hilos, zipper, broches, telas, botones, encajes y otros

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
My name is Ramona Zanchez. I have a store that sells hamburgers called Paraiso de la Hamburguesa (Hamburger Paradise). I have several years in this type of business. It provides me with the income to cover my family’s expenses and my kid’s education. Right now, I need to buy more products so I can satisfy the existing demand.

Loan Use: Purchase red meat and chicken, bread, vegetables, butter, oil, salt, spices, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, glasses, dishes, napkins, chili peppers, and refreshments.

MI nombre es Ramona Zanchez, cuento con un negocio de venta de amburguesas, yamado Paraiso de las Amburguesa, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, actuamente necesito comprar mas producto para poder satisfacer la demanda existente

loans.use: compra de carne de res y pollo, pan, vegetales, manteca, aceite, sal, especias, mayonesa, mostaza, salsa de tomate, vasos, platos, servilletas, chile, refrescos

payments.comment: Mi negocio mejoro por la calidad de alimentos y su preparacion, ahora necesito mas capital para surtir el negocio y poder atender a los visitantes.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.en:
I make covers for vehicle’s seats. Two years ago, I opened the store in my house. Currently, the city’s Mayor has granted me permission to have my own stand at the city’s market. Now I plan to have more sales, since it’s approached quite a bit. I’m also starting to sell used clothes at the same stand, and it’s going pretty well. However, I need to stock up my store so I can satisfy my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase fabric, thread, strings for securing covers, zippers, and others.

Fabricacion de cobertores para asientos de vehiculos, mi negocio lo instale en mi casa desde hace dos años, actualmente la Alcaldia de la Ciudad me ha concedido el permiso y tengo mi propio puesto en el mercado popular, ahora con este puesto pienso tener mejores ventas, ya que es bastante visitado. Tambien estoy iniciando a veder ropa usada en el mismo puesto y me ha ido bien, pero necesito abastecer mas mi negocio para poder satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: Tela, hilos, cordones de amarre, zippers y otros

loans.name: Delmis Esperanza

texts.en:
My name is Delmis Esperanza (hope). I have a small business in the house where I live and we call it Pulperia O.. We sell all types of food and have been doing this for a long time. I'd like to increase the number of products that we offer so that my customers have greater variety to choose from.

SPANISH
Mi nombre el Delmis Esperanza, cuento un un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación, llamada Pulperia O., con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, actuamente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de azucar, arroz, manteca,Pastas,salsa de tomate, confites, pan, carnes,embutidos y otros

loans.name: Alejandra Maria

texts.en:
My name is Alejandra. I have a stand where I sell sweets, burritas, chicken, refreshments, and others. My stand is located at the town’s market, and people visit it because its cleanliness and the tasty food I prepare for them. This is a family business. I have two employees who help me, and whenever my children are free in the afternoon, they come and help me prepare the food. Sales have improved quite a bit, and I hope to continue supporting my children’s education.

Loan Use: Purchase refreshments, vegetables, beans, cheese, butter, bread, and others.

Me llamo Alejandra y tengo un puesto de venta de golosinas, burritas, pollo, refrescos y otros. Mi puesto lo tengo ubicado en el mercado popular el que es visitado por varias personas y aprovechan visitar mi negocio por lo higienico y rica comida que les preparo. Este es un negocio familiar, tengo dos muchachas que me ayudan y por las tardes libres mis hijos vienen ayudarme a preparar los alimentos. Las ventas han mejorado bastante y espero poder seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, verduras, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, pan y otros

loans.name: Iris Emilse

texts.en:
My name is Emilse and I run a small business which sells business clothes, footwear and cosmeticos. I usually sell them on foot by travelling around the community.

I've been doing this for three years and it is going well. It supports my family and my children who only have a single parent to support them. Right now, Christmas is approaching and I need to access a loan so that I can prepare for the business that is certain to come.

loans.use: Compra de ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y otros

loans.name: Julia Danila

texts.en:
My Name the Julia Danila, I have a business and I work out of my house. I sell btoh new and used clothes. Also I distribute my product by travelling out of my home community to the neighboring villages. I've been selling clothes for several years. I work with suppliers and I need the loan to greatly increase the amount of inventory that I can purchase at once. I have two children studying and thanks to the income I hope to receive I would like to pay for their school fees.

SPANISH

Mi Nombre el Julia Danila, tengo un negocio en mi casa de habitacion de venta de Ropa Usada y ropa nueva, tambien distribuyo mi producto de manera ambulante en toda la comunidad y aldeas vecinas, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir compormisos con proveedores y cubrir gastos familiares y gastos de educacación de mis hijos, actualmente tengo dos hijos estudiando y gracias a los ingresos puedeo hacerle frente todos estos gastos

loans.use: Compra de  fardos de ropa clasificada y ropa nueva

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
In my country, “pupusas” are one of our favorite meals, and so are French fries. For this reason, I have a few years of making and selling these. I sale right outside the room where I live, in one of the main streets of my community. People are always asking for something different, and this helps me to have good sales, especially during the weekends. Currently, one of my children is going to college, and I help him with his expenses. My income helps me pay for utilities, healthcare and food.

Loan Use: Corn flour, cabbage, potatoes, butter, wood, spices, and others.

En nuestro pais las pupusas es uno de nuestras comidas favoritas, al igual que las papas fritas, por lo que tengo algunos años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de estos alimentos. Mis ventas las hago frente a mi casa de habitacion en una de las principales calles de mi colonia. Las personas siempre quieren comer algo diferente lo que me ayuda a tener buenas ventas, especialmente los fines de semana. Actualmente tengo 1 hijo estudiando en la universidad y le ayudo con sus gastos, mis ingresos me ayudan a pagar los servicios publicos, mi salud y alimentacion.

loans.use: Harina de maiz, repollo, papas, manteca, leña, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Danubia  Lizeth

texts.en: My Name the Danubia and I run a store which sells fabrics for for preparations of suits, cortines, beds.  My family has been doing this for several years and it supports us.

loans.use: Comprar telas de diferentes estilos(Confeccion de Trajes, cortinas, cameras, manteles y otros)

payments.comment: Gracias a su ayuda pude mejorar mis ventas ahora necesito mas capital para comprar nuevas telas y atender a mi clientela.

loans.name: Martha Josefina

texts.en:
My name is Martha Jossefina. I have a store in my community’s downtown. I’ve been in this type of business for several years. It provides me with the necessary income to contribute to my family’s expenses and my children’s education. My biggest wish is to stock up my store, in order to offer a variety of products to my clients, and that way improve my business’ profits.

Loan Use: Purchase sugar, butter, rice, coffee, flour, beans, corn, pasta, dairy products, meat, and sausage.

Mi Nombre es Martha Jossefina, cuento con un negocio en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con mis gastos familiares y educacion de mis hijos, mi mayor deseo es surtir mas mi negocio para ofrecer variedad de productos a mis clites y de esa forma mejorar las utilidades de mi negocio.

loans.use: compra de azucar, manteca, arroz, cafe, harina, frijoles, maiz, pastas, Productos Lacteos, carnes y embutidos

payments.comment: Mi negocio ha incrementado en ventas, esto es bueno para mi y mi familia, gracias por el apoyo.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina G. has been selling corn for 5 years. She prepares them very deliciously by first putting on butter or mayonnaise, then cheese, then lemon and hot sauce. Mmm, really flavorful.

Mrs. Evangelina sells them in her car and visits certain streets of the city, she has some sound equipment in her car that lets her announce the flavorful corn sale. Mrs. Evangelina G. would like to also open a fixed corn stall close to her house. With these two places of sale, one mobile in her car, and the other one fixed, it should increase her sales. She will acquire the fixed stall through a loan of $800 and she is determined to pay it back in a term of 1 year. With this loan she could increase her sales and generate a good income for her family. Besides, she is able to sell her delicious corn in another part of the city, well know in Nuevo Laredo, mmm.

ESPANOL

La Sra, Evangelina vende elotes desde hace 5 años, los prepara deliciosos, les agraga mantequilla o mayonesa y luego espolvorea queso ademas puede agregarles limon o chile, mmm realmente sabrosos. La Sra.Evangelina los vende en su auto y visita ciertas calles de la ciudad, ella va anunciandose atraves de un equipo de sonido que instala en su auto. La Sra. Evangelina pretende instalar un puesto fijo de venta de elotes cerca de su casa para incrementar sus ventas, con esto tendria ya dos puntos de venta uno movil en su auto y el otro fijo, este lo pretende adquirir atraves de un prestamo de $800.00 y para el cual tiene contemplado pagarlo en un plazo de 1 año, con dicho prestamo ella podria aumentar sus ventas y generar bienestar familiar, ademas de poder vender en otra parte de la ciudad sus ricos y deliciosos elotes, ya conocidos en Nuevo Laredo mmm.

loans.use: install a fixed sales point

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
My Name is Julia and I sell used clothes around many different districts in my city.

I've been doing this for several years. I recently acquired a car which will help me be less tied to selling out of my house and will enable me to travel to the busiest places where I can sell the most clothes.

Now I need a loan to enable me to buy more used clothes that I can sell with my increased mobility.

loans.use: Compra de fardos de ropa clasificada y otros

payments.comment: Mis ventas mejoraron por la calidad y variedad de ropa que pude comprar con el prestamo que me otorgaron, gracias por su ayuda.

loans.name: Fanny Guadalupe

texts.en:
Hello.  My name is Fanny Guadalupe.  I have a business that sells used clothing in the center of my city.  I have been dedicating myself to this type of work for several years and I earn enough money to contribute to family and other expenses.  Actually, I need greater investment to satisfy the demand of existing clients. 

Hola mi Nombre el Fanny Guadalupe, tengo un negocio de venta de ropa usada, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad. cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente necesito  mayor inversison para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Compra de Fardos de ropa usada clasificada

payments.comment: Gracias a su ayuda mis ventas mejoraron, ahora tengo que surtir con ropa de verano es por lo que necesito capital fresco para invertir.

loans.name: Fanny Yanireth

texts.en:
My name is Fanny Yanireth. I have a used clothes store located in this city’s downtown. I’ve been in this industry for several years. My income allows me to pay my suppliers, and my family’s expenses. We currently need a car to be able to bring merchandise from the capital city to our city.

Loan Use: Purchase categorized bulks of American clothes

Mi nombre el Fanny Yanireth, tengo un negocio de ropa usasa ubicado en uno de los barrios mas centricos de esta ciudad, cueanto con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis compromisos con proveedores y gastos familiares, actuamente necesitamos un carro para poder transportar la mercaderia desde la capital a nuestra ciudad.

loans.use: Compra de fardos clasificados de ropa americana

payments.comment: Las ventas de mi negocio se incrementaron gracias a la variedad de ropa que pude comprar, ahora quiero surtir mejor el negocio y vender ropa de todos precios para mejorar mucho mas mis ingresos.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Mrs. Cristina started her grocery store because she has always liked selling since she was a child when her family had a business. When Mrs. Christina retired (she was a teacher), she decided to start her business to earn an additional income to support her family.

She is married and her husband is retired too. They have three children and, when Mrs. Christina and her husband started their business, their children were still studying. Now their children are finished and one of them helps in their business. Cristina has an employee who helps her with the little restaurant that she started a year ago as complement to her groceries business.

Cristina is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to supply her grocery store with merchandise and to buy some furniture that she needs for her restaurant. She wants to pay back in a term of 10-14 months.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Desde hace 15 años que la Sra. Cristina inicio su negocio de minisuper, siempre le gusto el comercio, pues desde pequeña su familia tenía negocio, pero no fue hasta que se jubiló de maestra, que se decidió a iniciar su negocio, para tener un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su familia. Ella esta casada y su esposo también esta jubilado, tienen tres hijos y cuando iniciaron su negocio sus hijos estaban estudiando, ya terminaron sus estudios y solo uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio. Aparte de la familia, tiene una empleada que le ayuda en su negocio, ya que a los abarrotes los complemento con el servicio de ofrecer comidas y ha tenido una muy buena aceptación.

Cristina esta solicitando un crédito por $ 1,200 USD para surtir de mercancía su negocio de abarrotes y para comprar algo de mobiliario que necesita en las comidas. El plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 10-14 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and furniture

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago Mrs. Cristina started her grocery store because she always likes selling and since she was a child her family had a business, but until se was retired she decided to start her business and in this way to earn an additional income to support her family. She is married and her husband is retired too, they have three children and when they started their business, their children were studying, now they are finished and just one of them helps in their business. Cristina has an employee who helps her with the little restaurant that she started a year ago as complement of her groceries business.

Cristina is requesting a loan by $1,200 USD to supply of merchandise her grocery store and to buy some furniture that she needs for her restaurant. She wants to pay back in a term of 10-14 months.

"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Desde hace 15 años que la Sra. Cristina inicio su negocio de minisuper, siempre le gusto el comercio, pues desde pequeña su familia tenía negocio, pero no fue hasta que se jubiló de maestra, que se decidió a iniciar su negocio, para tener un ingreso adicional para apoyar a su familia. Ella esta casada y su esposo también esta jubilado, tienen tres hijos y cuando iniciaron su negocio sus hijos estaban estudiando, ya terminaron sus estudios y solo uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio. Aparte de la familia, tiene una empleada que le ayuda en su negocio, ya que a los abarrotes los complemento con el servicio de ofrecer comidas y ha tenido una muy buena aceptación.

Cristina esta solicitando un crédito por $ 1,200 USD para surtir de mercancía su negocio de abarrotes y para comprar algo de mobiliario que necesita en las comidas. El plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 10-14 meses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and furniture

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Mi nombre es Vicenta y me dedico a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niño, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio con el que he sacado adelante a mis hijos en sus estudios. En esta epoca de Navidad es buena temporada para las ventas asi que quiero brindar variedad en ropa y precios.

loans.use: Compra de ropa dama, caballero y niño.

loans.name: Francisco Emigdio

texts.en:
Francisco is married and is 30 years old. He is a very entrepreneurial person and with an attitude conducive to growth. His wife is an accountant but she left her profession to dedicate herself to her house.

Francisco worked in many companies but his schedule of work did not allow him to do other activities. So, he decided to start his own business: one that let him study a professional career in marketing and allowed him to obtain better income to offer his wife a better quality of life. In 1998, a friend of his invited him to be partners in delivering large decanter water. With the passage of time, he decided to end the partnership and start by himself.

Francisco's business was successful and he wanted to buy a truck to deliver the large decanter water. For this reason, Francisco is requesting a loan of US$ 475 and offers to pay in 5 months. He wants the loan because he needs to purchase merchandise and widen his delivery route so he can increase the number of clients he has

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Francisco esta casado y tiene 30 años de edad, es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de salir adelante y seguir creciendo. Su esposa es contadora de profesión pero dejo de ejercer su profesión para dedicarse al hogar. Francisco trabajó en varias empresas pero los horarios de sus empleos no le permitían realizar otras actividades. Fue entonces cuando decidió iniciar su propio negocio que le permitiera estudiar una carrera profesional que actualmente es la de Licenciado en mercadotecnia, además también fue la necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos para ofrecerle a su esposa mejores condiciones de vida. En 1998 un amigo lo invito a ser su socio en el negocio de repartición de garrafones de agua, pero con el tiempo decidió separarse y abrir el suyo propio y le fue muy bien a tal grado que pudo comprarse una camioneta para repartir los garrafones de agua. Por ello Francisco esta solicitando un crédito de US $475 a 5 meses para poder comprar más garrafones de agua y refacciones para su vehículo y así poder ampliar su ruta de trabajo y sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alicia Julieta

texts.en:
Alicia is married and is 55 years old. She is a very active and entrepreneurial woman and always worried for the welfare of her family. She has 2 daughters (both are professionals) and her husband is a bricklayer.

Alicia has been a pensioned woman since 1998 and so she had to educate her daughters without her salary. Her pension was not enough for this so she decided to start her own business and opened a store in which she sells clothes, gifts and ceramics. Alicia wanted to support her husband with the family expenses and cover her daughters' studies' cost.

Alicia is requesting a loan of US$ 475 and offers to pay in 5 months. She needs this loan to purchase merchandise to have more than she has now. This is especially important this time of the year when her sales usually increase.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Alicia esta casada y tiene 55 años de edad, es una mujer muy active y emprendedora que esta siempre al cuidado del bienestar de su hogar. Tiene dos hijas y ambas son profesionales, su esposo es un obrero que también hace pequeños trabajos como hojalatería y pintura. Alicia fue jubilada de su trabajo en 1998 motivo por el cual decidió abrir su propia empresa de compra y venta de ropa, regalos y cerámica para continuar ayudando a su esposo en los gastos familia y sacar a sus hijas adelante en sus estudios. Alicia esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 475 a 5 meses para pagar con el cual podrá adquirir más mercancías y tener un mejor surtido en estos últimos meses del año en que se incrementan las ventas.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is a married woman who is 49 years old. She has 2 daughters and 2 sons, of which two still live with her, and 4 grandsons that also live with her. She is an entrepreneur and a fighting woman who has loved to work since she was a child.

When Maria de Lourdes was 12 years old, she began to work selling clothes, shoes and jewelry. After, she just sold clothes in the downtown of her city. She quit selling shoes because there was significant competition and different varieties of shoes that she could not offer to her clients. Unfortunately, she also could not compete in the clothing business but she decided that she should help her husband because he works in a marine platform of Pemex and his salary is not enough for all of their family.

So, Maria de Lourdes started her business in her own house but this time she sold more articles including clothes, gifts, and ceramics. Actually, one of the daughters that lives with Maria de Lourdes supports her with the business and Maria de Lourdes is requesting a loan of US$ 550 to purchase more merchandise. She needs more merchandise because she at this time of the year it is the best to sell. Maria de Lourdes purchases clothes from Tulancingo, Puebla and ceramic from Tonala, Jalisco.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

María de Lourdes es una mujer casada de 49 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas y 2 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos aún viven con ella y además también viven con ella 4 nietos. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, siempre ha tenido el gusto por el trabajo, especialmente como comerciante. Desde muy pequeña tenía gusto por el comercio y a los 12 años de edad empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos de belleza Avon, zapatos, y joyería. Luego empezó vendiendo ropa en el centro de la ciudad por que en la venta de zapatos existía mucha competencia y diversos tipos de créditos a los clientes y ella no pudo competir por el volumen que manejaba, pero desafortunadamente el negocio de la ropa tampoco le funciono y entonces decidió que debía de continuar ayudando a su esposo en los gastos familiares, ya que su esposo trabaja en una plataforma marina de Pemex y sus ingresos para toda la familia eran insuficientes. Por ello María de Lourdes empezó su propio negocio en su domicilio con un giro ya más amplio como es la ropa, regalos y cerámica. Actualmente en el negocio la ayuda una de sus hijas que vive con ella y esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 550 que los piensa pagar en 5 meses, el cual utilizará para adquirir más mercancías y aprovechar la temporada navideña que es cuando ella ha registrado ventas más altas en todo el año y se abastece de ropa en Tulancingo, Puebla y de Cerámica en Tonalá, Jalisco.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
In 1975, Francisca’s husband started a buy and sell book business working with many editorials. Unfortunately in 1993, her husband died in an accident and she had the responsibility of her family that currently includes three children that are studying. Francisco must work to care for and educate them.

Francisca's husband's business was good so she decided to continue it. Francisco also knew the business well and also was able to take advantage of her husband's portfolio of clients and contact with editorials.

Francisca has a very good stock in her store but the books have a high cost and she needs to purchase more to cover the commercial order by school teachers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 650 payable in 5 months.

Francisca's children support her in their free time because, thanks to the business, they were able to study when they were younger. One of her children is a mathematician teacher, another is a business administrator, and the youngest one still studies at the university. Francisca feels so proud of her achievements because, despite pain for her dead husband, he left a legacy of love for work and responsibility, values that she now sees in her children.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

En 1975 el esposo de Francisca inició un negocio de compra – venta de libros texto, trabajando con varias editoriales, desafortunadamente en 1993, su esposo falleció en un accidente y enviudo con la carga económica de 3 hijos y todos estaban estudiando así que era necesario trabajar para sacarlos adelante. Como el negocio estaba bien acreditado, tomo la decisión de continuarlo, pues concia bien la actividad y además tenía que aprovechar la cartera de clientes y el contacto con las editoriales. Francisca tiene su local bien surtido pero los libros son caros y necesita surtir pedidos que le hacen algunos maestros de escuelas, es por eso que en estos momentos requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $7,000 a 5 meses. Ahora sus hijos en sus ratos libres la apoyan con el negocio, pues de lo que ahí se generaba lograron estudiar; uno de ellos es Maestro de matemáticas y otra de sus hijas es Lic. En Administración de empresas, la más pequeña continúa estudiando en la universidad. Francisca se siente satisfecha con lo que ha logrado, pues a pesar de haber perdido a su brazo derecho, les dejo un legado de amor al trabajo y responsabilidad, valores que ahora aprecia en sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase school books

loans.name: Concepción Manuela

texts.en:
Concepción is a married woman who is 22 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a laborer but when she saw that her husband’s salary was not enough to cover her family expenses she decided to start a small business selling shoes two years ago. In the beginning, she only took money from her husband’s salary, but now her business has been growing and her sales have increased as well. For that reason, she wants to prepare for the next Christmas season because she knows it is the best sales season of the year.

She is requesting a loan of $ 475 USD to supply her merchandise and to be able to offer credit to her clients. In this way, she can obtain better profits. Concepcion thinks she will be able to pay back the loan in a term of 6-12 months.

"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Concepción es una mujer casada, de 22 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y su esposo trabaja como obrero , pero al ver que no le alcanzaba con el ingreso de su esposo a cubrir todos los gastos de su familia, decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de zapatos hace dos años. En un inicio solo podía tomar dinero del gasto que le daba su esposo, pero poco a poco ha ido haciendo crecer sus ventas y es por ello que ahora quiere prepararse para la temporada navideña, ya que por experiencia sabe que es la mejor temporada de ventas de su negocio.

Concepción solicita un crédito por $ 475 USD para poder surtirse de zapatos para poder ofrecer a crédito a sus clientes, de esa forma obtiene mayores utilidades, ella piensa pagar el préstamo en un plazo de 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Norma Argentina

texts.en:
My name is Norma, and I have a stand at Los Pinos School. I work Monday-Friday, and I’ve been here for the last three years. My sales are good since the school’s students always buy food and sweets. During the months when the school is closed, I sell used clothes. So, during that time I need to buy bulks of categorized clothes to distribute among my clients. These businesses provide me with a good income, which allow me to support my children’s education and pay for my family’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase cheese, beans, tortillas, bananas, refreshments, churros, sweets, cookies, and others.

Me llamo Norma y tengo una caseta en la Escuela Los Pinos, tengo 3 años de trabajar en esta caseta en la que trabajo de Lunes a Viernes. Mis ventas son buenas ya que los alumnos de la escuela siempre compran comida y golosinas. Tambien vendo ropa usada en los meses que cierran la escuela, por lo que en esta epoca necesito comprar fardos de ropa clasificada para distribuirla entre mis clientes. Estos negocios me dejan buenas ganancias con lo que mantengo a mis hijos en sus estudios y gastos familiares.

loans.use: Compra de queso, frijoles, tortillas, platanos, refrescos, churros, confites, galletas y otros.

loans.name: Pedro Ronmer

texts.en:
My name is Pedro Ronmer. I have a small business in the center of my city. I sell products that are used in the home. The business earns enough to support my family and other commitments. I am a single father. I have one daughter. At the moment, my wish is to increase my business and have my own location.

Loan Use: Purchase creams, shampoo, toys, flashlights, washing powder, toothpaste and other supplies.

Mi nombre es Pedro Ronmer, cuento con un pequeño negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, de venta de productos de uso en el hogar, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares otros compromisos, soy padre soltero y tengo una hija en mi poder, actualmente deseo surtir mas mi negocio y tener mi propio local.

loans.use: Compra de cremas, champo, Juguetes, focos de mano,paste de lavar trastes, sepillos de pila, pastas de diente y otros

loans.name: Felix Daniel

texts.en:
I’ve had my store for two years, and it’s the only one in the area. I currently sell basic grains, dairies, chicken, but I need money to invest more since during the next months sales go up. I am putting a lot of effort in keeping my store in good condition because at my age it is very hard to find a job at a company, and I need to provide my wife with food, clothes, and also cover her health expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase refreshments, eggs, bread, milk, flour, and others.

Tengo dos años de tener mi pulperia, en la que vendo ya que en esta zona es la unica. Actualmente estoy surtiendo mi negocio vendiendo granos basicos, lacteos, pollo, pero necesito el capital para invertir mas, ya que estos meses es de bastante ventas. Estoy poniendo todo mi esfuerzo en mantener bien mi negocio ya que a mi edad es muy dificil poder trabajar en una empresa y necesito darle a mi esposa su alimentacion, sus gastos para la salud y ropa.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, huevos, pan, leche, harina y otros.

loans.name: Alba Liliana

texts.en:
In my region I am known as Albita. For three years I have been dedicated to selling maiz tortillas that I prepare them in my house.

I sell tortillas in the mornin and late and night. I have really faithful customers because the tortilla is a necessary part of the diet in this region.

For a few months I have begun to sell grains as frijoles and rice and the sales have been promising. I would like the loan to help me sell more of this new product.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal y leña.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
I prepare natural meals and refreshments. I’ve had my business for five years, and it’s been going well. My clients choose me for my yummy burritas I prepare (tortilla with meat, fried beans, and butter). In the mornings is when I sell the most, because I deliver my meals to offices. During weekends, I sell beauty products such as cosmetics and lotions. This provides me with an extra income that helps me cover my children’s expenses.

Loan Use: Purchase tortillas, chicken, sausage, butter, cheese, beans, fruits, and others.

Mi actividad es la elaboracion de alimentos y refrescos naturales, tengo cinco años de tener mi negocio y me ha ido bien. Mis clientes me prefieren por las ricas burritas (tortilla con carne, frijolitos fritos y mantequilla) que preparo, por la mañana es cuando mas vendo, ya que entrego mi comida en oficinas, los fines de semana vendo productos de belleza como cosmeticos, lociones, cremas esto me genera un ingreso extra que bastante me ayuda con los gastos de mis hijos.

loans.use: Compra de tortillas, pollo, chorizo, mantequilla, queso, frijoles, frutas y otros

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
I have been dedicated to tortilla sales for some years, unfortunately I did not have the resources to prepare. The reason why I work strongly is so that my children can go to the university and who they have a good style of life. At the moment I work next to my mother and we shared the daily profits. Now, I want to contract another girl to increase my sales and power to give tortillas in neighboring areas.

SPANISH

Me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace algunos años, desafortunadamente no tuve los recursos para prepararme, por lo que trabajo fuertemente para que mis hijos puedan graduarse en la universidad y que tengan un buen estilo de vida. Actualmente trabajo junto a mi madre y compartimos las ganancias diarias, por lo que quiero contratar a otra muchacha para incrementar mis ventas y poder entregar tortillas en colonias vecinas a la mia.

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, cal, leña y otros.

loans.name: Santos Irma

texts.en:
My activity involves selling products of popular consumption such as juices, milk, eggs, bread, and others, at the store I have in my city. Besides, I sell gas, water, oil for cars, filters, and brakes fluid. I’ve had this business for five years, and the income is pretty good since it’s located at the taxicab and bus terminal of my community. I give credit to the motorists, who pay me weekly. I think I’ve done alright because I’ve had enough income to support my family.

Loan Use: Purchase refreshments, juices, dairies, churros, bread, milk, eggs, and others.

Mi actividad es la venta de productos de consumo popular como jugos, leche, huevos pan y otros, ya que tengo una pulperia en mi ciudad, aparte vendo gas, agua, aceite para vehiculos, filtros, liquido para frenos. Este negocio lo tengo desde hace cinco años el que me genera buenos ingresos ya que esta ubicada en la terminal de taxis y buses de mi colonia. Les doy credito a los motoristas quienes me pagan semanalmente y considero que me ha ido bien ya que he tenido buenos ingresos para sostener a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de refrescos, jugos, lacteos, churros, pan, leche, huevos, y otros

loans.name: Juana Olivia

texts.en:
Juana Olivia is 31 years old and is a single mother with two daughters. One of them is 9 years old and the other one is 3 years old. She comments that she has always loved sales and she considers herself an entrepreneurial woman.

Juana Olivia worked in a department store, but her work schedule kept her very busy all day. The salary was extremely low and she did not have much time to see her children.

In February of 2004, she decided to start her own business because she needed to obtain an income to help maintain her family\\\'s needs. And because she loves sales, when a friend invited her to begin in a cosmetic sales business, she happily accepted.

Now she is an independent business woman and has enough time to take care of her children. And she has seen that her income is increasing. Juana Olivia is requesting a loan of US$475 and is determined to pay back in 4 months. With this loan, she will be able to purchase a large order for her cosmetics company because she must be prepared for Christmas season.

**This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juana Olivia tiene 31 años, es Madre Soltera tiene 2 hijas de 9 y 3 años, comenta que siempre le han gustado las ventas y se considera una persona inquieta y muy emprendedora. Ella se desempeñaba como vendedora en tiendas departamentales, pero los horarios de trabajo le absorbían todo el día, los sueldos eran muy bajos y no le quedaba mucho tiempo para atender a sus hijas. Comenta que en Febrero del 2004, tomo la decisión de iniciar un negocio, porque necesitaba obtener ingresos para sostener a sus hijas y como le gustan las ventas, aprovecho la invitación de una amiga para comenzar vendiendo cosméticos. Gracias a que es independiente ahora cuenta con más tiempo para atender a sus hijas y sus ingresos son mayores pues con sus ventas lo mínimo que obtiene de ingresos es de US$10 diarios. Esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 475 a 4 meses pues en la compañía de cosméticos surtió un pedido grande y necesita pagar esa factura, pues en Diciembre las ventas se incrementan y ella no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sixto Hernandez

texts.en:
Hello, everyone. I’m known as Sixto “The smiley”. I always try to welcome my clients with a smile, and treat them nicely. I have a small store located at the public transportation terminal in Danli. I started out managing my brother’s store, and then I decided to have one of my own. I’ve been able to grow. When I started, I used to rent a space, and later I was able to buy one. That’s where I have the store now. With the income from sales I’m making my business grow, and am able to provide my family with education, healthcare, food, and clothes.

Loan Use: Purchase bread, flour, eggs, refreshments, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, and others.

Hola todos me conocen como Sixto el sonriente, siempre he tratado de atender a mis clientes con una sonrisa y amblemente, tengo un mercadito ubicada en la terminal de trasportes de Danli. Inicie administrando el negocio de mi hermano, luego decidi dedicarme a mi negocio propio y he logrado crecer, comence alquilando local luego compre el propio donde actualmente tengo mi negocio. Con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas estoy logrando que mi negocio crezca y darle a mi familia educacion, salud, alimento y vestuario.

loans.use: Compra de pan, harina, huevos, refrescos, frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe y otros.

loans.name: Dalia Lizeth

texts.en:
My name is Dalia and I’m a peddler. I buy and sell jewelry, specifically gold plated, and I sell cosmetics and toiletries. The latter provides me an additional income, which helps me in giving my kids better education opportunities.

Loan Use: Purchase gold plated chains, earrings, and rings.

Me llamo Dalia y soy comerciante ambulante, me dedico a la compra y venta de joyeria en general, especificamente en el enchape de oro y venta de cosmeticos y perfumeria. Este ingreso es adicional lo que mejora los ingresos familiares, proporcionando a mis hijos mejores oportunidades de estudio.

loans.use: Compra de enchape de oro en cadenas, aritos, anillos.

loans.name: Martha Elva

texts.en:
Martha Elva is married and her husband is an industrial painter and works for a company. She comments that in 2000, she started to sell products like cookies, chocolates and shoes to obtain additional incomes to help in the family expenses. Soon her business began to consolidate.Unfortunately, she went to the doctor and her diagnostic was high corporal fat meaning she was a very high risk for a heart attack. A friend of her recommended natural products that could help her with the problem. She did it and her health was better, so she was convinced of the quality of the products started to sell them. Martha Elva needs a loan of US $ 825 to purchase merchandise for this season and increase her incomes.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Martha Elva esta casada y su esposo es pintor industrial y trabaja para una compañía. Comenta que en el año 2000 comenzó a vender productos como galletas, chocolates, y zapatos, pues necesitaba obtener ingresos adicionales, para poder solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Pronto el negocio se empezó a consolidar, pero en una ocasión que fue a realizarse un cheque medico, los resultados le arrojaron alto grado de grasa corporal y en estas condiciones, en cualquier momento podría sufrir un infarto. Una amiga le recomendó utilizar unos productos naturales que podían ayudarle con su problema, fue así como de inicio a consumirlos y su salud mejoro considerablemente, convencida de la calidad de los productos entonces empezó a promoverlos para su venta. A la fecha necesita un crédito pues hacia finales de año, se incrementan las ventas por lo que necesita estar preparada, Esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $825 a 6 meses. El cual le permitirá surtir mercancía suficiente para la temporada navideña y mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Armando Leon

texts.en:
My name is Armando. I want everyone to know that we run a small store out of our house with the help of my whole family.

We are many sleeping in the same house which is also used as a warehouse for the inventory we keep overnight.

Thanks to this business I have been able to help to my family and my daughter who is 6 years old and start her studies. At this moment I need to provide my business for the Christmas season where all the people look for products to prepare their family meals.

loans.use: Compra de churros, panes, leche, huevos, refrescos y otros.

loans.name: Edgardo Daniel

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Edgardo and I own a small store where I sell sweets, churros, and cookies. When I stopped working for companies, I started selling in the streets to have income to help my family. Now I have my little store across the street from a school, and the kids are my best clients. With my income I can help my children with their education, and my family with the expenses. My goal is to have a bigger store at home, increase my income, and offer my family a better quality of life.

Loan Use: Purchase chewing gum, candy, churros, cookies, and others.

Hola, mi nombre es Edgardo y soy dueño de un pequeño negocio en el que vendo dulces, churros, galletas. Desde que deje de trabajar en empresas me dedique a vender en las calles para poder tener ingresos y ayudar a mi familia. Ahora tengo mi chiclera frenta a una escuela y los niños de este centro de estudio son mis mejores clientes. Con los ingresos que tengo puedo ayudar a mis dos hijos en sus estudios y con el gasto familiar. Mi meta es poder tener una pulperia en mi casa para tener mejores ingresos y darle a mi familia un mejor estilo de vida.

loans.use: Compra de chiclets, confites, churros, galletas y otros.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria Esther is an enthusiastic woman and is 50 years old. She loves sales and started her business on August of 2004. She comments that for her age she had hormonal problems and had a lot of headaches, so a friend of hers invited her to take natural products and in 15 days her problems disappeared. Maria Esther needed an extra income that could help her contribute to the family expenses. After her experiences with the natural products, she was eager to offer them to others with the hope the products would help them as well. Her husband is a carpenter and works independently. They have two sons who are both are professionals. Maria Esther is requesting for a loan of US$ 825 and offers to pay it back in 6 months. With the loan she wants to purchase merchandise and take advantage of the demand before the end of the year.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

María Esther es una mujer entusiasta que con 50 años de edad le gusta dedicarse a las ventas. Comenzó su negocio en Agosto de 2004, comenta que por cuestiones de su edad padecía trastornos hormonales, y le dolía mucho la cabeza; entonces una amiga la invito a un desayuno de los que organiza la casa productora de Productos Naturales y al consumirlos en 15 días desaparecieron las molestias y su salud mejoro notablemente. Necesitaba contar con un ingreso adicional que le permitiera contribuir para solventar los gastos familiares; por lo que viendo los resultados en su persona, no dudo en comenzar a venderlos; pues también le han funcionado a su madre quien al consumirlos ha podido sobrellevar una enfermedad Terminal. Su esposo es de oficio carpintero y se desempeña en forma independiente, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudiaron y ahora son profesionales técnicos uno en el ramo de la construcción y otro en el ramo de la petroquímica. Necesita un préstamo de $825 y pagarlos a 6 meses, para poder adquirir mercancía y poder aprovechar la demanda que se da en los últimos meses del año.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
I distribute vegetables in communities throughout the city where I live. I’ve been in this business for several years, and it’s given me enough income to support my family. My mayor clients are owners of food stores and mini-grocery stores, and also people who walk up to my stand to buy tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. Right now, demand is high so I need to stock up with good products to satisfy my client’s needs.

Loan Use: Purchase chili peppers, onions, and tomatoes

Me dedico a la distribucion de verduras en comunidades de mi ciudad. Tengo varios años de dedicarme a este negocio que me ha generado buenos ingresos para mantener a mi familia. Mis mayores compradores son personas dueñas de pulperias y mercaditos, asi como particulares que se acercan a mi carro a comprar tomates, cebollas o la verdura que les ofrezca. Ahorita tengo bastante demanda por lo que necesito abastecerme de buenos productos para satisfacer la necesidad de mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de chiles, cebollas y tomates.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.en:
My name is Luis Alonso U., and I am a salesman. I have a small store in one of the busiest areas in my community. I have several years in this industry. With the income from sales at my store I am able to cover my family’s expenses, and other commitments. My idea is to offer new products at my little store, so I can improve my sales, and therefore my income.

Loan Use: Purchase hair accessories, bracelets, earrings, necklaces, rings, shoes, nail polish, lipstick, and others.

Mi nombre el Luis Alonso U., son comerciente tengo un pequeño negocio en uno de los lugares mas transitados de mi comunidad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, mis ideas es de surtir mas minegocio para mejorar la ventas y por ende mis ingresos.

loans.use: Venta de ganchos para el pelo, colas, pulceras, aritos,collares, anillos, zapatos,esmaltes, Listip y otros

loans.name: Nora Odalis

texts.en:
My Name is Nora Odalis. I sell underclothes!

This business generates income for my family and I've been doing it for 2 years. The volume of sales really increases at Christmas so I need to buy more underclothes to prepare for when people give them as gifts!

loans.use: Compra de Ropa Interior de ambos sexos, camisas, pantalontes de baron, sandalia de niño, trajes de niño, y otros

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is applying for his second loan through Kiva after he finished paying off his first successfully. He originally started out by borrowing a little bit from his mother so that he could sell chicken out of their house. He realized that he would need to become a member of the market near his house in order to reach his customers. Two years have gone by, and everything is going well for Marcos. His wife and daughter constantly motivate him to work hard because Mr. Ordonez is the only source of income for the family right now. Marcos is applying for a new loan so that he can purchase items in cash at the local markets in order to get great discounts and pass the savings on to his customers. With this money he hopes to buy a refrigerator, as well as more chicken and eggs. Right now he claims that he does not have access to credit from a formal bank because he cannot meet the stringent, and often unforgiving, requirements that they impose. The profits generated from the business help Marcos to pay for personal costs, such as education for his daughter, medicine, and food.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: With this money he hopes to buy a refrigerator, as well as more chicken and eggs.

loans.name: Nelson Martin

texts.en:
My name is Nelson Martin and I have a small business of sale of fruits located. It is several years old and generates income to cover the education of my children. My wife collaborates in the business, as well. One of my plans future is to buy a car.

Hola mi Nombre es Nelson Martin, tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas ubicado en el Mercado de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, mi esposa que colabora en el negocio, uno de mis planes futuro es comprar un carro para salir a vender de manera ambulante y mi esposa se quedara atendiendo el puesto, de esa forma mejoraremos nuestros ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de Naranjas, ciruelas, piñas, cocos,manzanas, uvas, peras, bananos, naces.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco has over 25 years of experience selling veterinary medicine and pet products. Although one would not expect poor family's to have pets they are prevalent in these communities as domestic partners and a source of income. Francisco has been able to take advantage of this with his business which is the only one in the neighborhood to offer food and medicine for animals. With his loan he was able to buy these products at wholesale prices. Once he generated profit from the increased inventory he was able to make improvements to his shop. He now offers seminars and workshops that teach the community how to raise chickens and other animals that can generate revenue. He not only sees this as a service to his neighborhood, he also generates business from the participants of his free courses. Francisco originally opened his business by saving a little bit of money and buying animal food and medicine. His wife and children help out in the store, so this has become somewhat of a family operation for the Ordonezes. With Mifex’s courses, Marcos has begun keeping inventory records and basic accounting, so that he can move into the banking mainstream and maintain a better credit profile. He is applying for this second loan so that he can buy hangers, a display case, and reorganize his store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He is applying for this second loan so that he can buy hangers, a display case, and reorganize his store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria G. is part of Mifex’s first class of borrowers. Not only has she repaid her first loan successfully, she already knows exactly how she plans to use the money from her next loan. She and her husband started this business over 30 years ago when all they had was $10, and they sold treats to children. As they grew, Ms. G. and her husband began selling basic household items to customers from the neighborhood. As her only source of income, Maria knows that she has to keep business going well all throughout the year. Luckily, Mifex offers insurance to our borrowers in times of sickness and disaster so they can cope with many of life’s struggles.

Maria is asking for a new loan so that she can be able to purchase more goods in cash and receive discounts from her distributors. This will create more healthy competition and ultimately bring more clients into her store. Because many of the formal banks consider inhabitants of Ms. G.’s "zona" high risk, they do not loan to them. Maria realizes what an incredible opportunity it is to have Mifex and Kiva administering her loan when no one else will. She intends to buy rice, sugar, and cleaning supplies for her store.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She intends to buy rice, sugar, and cleaning supplies for her store.

loans.name: Victor  Hugo

texts.en:
My name is Victor Hugo, and my wife and I have had a business in clothing sales for the past 3 years. This allows us to cover various expenses One day, I'd like to have my businesson the sidewalk of one of the parks in my city.

Mi Nombre es Victor Hugo, tengo un negocio de venta de ropa usada en el centro de mi ciudad es que es administrado junto con mi esposa, cuento con 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que nos genera ingreso para cubrir los diferentes gastos familiares y demas compromisos, mi mayor anhelo es tener un local ya que donde tengo el negocio es en la acera de uno de los parque de mi ciudad.

loans.use: Compra de ropa usada clasificada

loans.name: Belki Yessenia

texts.en:
My name is Belki Yessenia. I’m a saleswomen. I have a store in the commercial area in my city. I’ve been in this industry for two years. With the income from my business, I can pay for my family’s expenses, and my education. I am single, and am currently in third year of College. My idea is to stock up my store so I can offer more variety to my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase women’s shirts and jeans, men’s jeans, t-shirts, purses, dresses, skirts, and lotions.

Mi Nombre el Belki Yessenia, soy comerciante, tengo un negocio en la zona del comercio de mi ciudad, cuento con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, con este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos familiares y de estudio, ya que soy soltera y actualmente curso el tercer añod en la Universidad, mi idea es de surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de Blusas de mujer, Jeans de Mujer, Jeans de Varon, camisetas, cartera, lociones,bestidos, faldas

loans.name: Radka

texts.en:
Radka is a 20-year-old budding entrepreneur from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. She is married with two children. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have scant access to credit.

Last month, Radka opened up a tiny food shop where she sells inexpensive packaged foods on the main square in the ghetto. Her plan is to begin selling hot sandwiches from her shop. She realizes that there is little margin in selling pre-packaged foods and, while she may not phrase it this way, wants to get into a higher value added service business. Previously, she thought she would have to wait a year to build up the capital to afford the equipment she will need for this venture; she was thrilled to hear about the Kiva program and the credit you can offer her. Radka has never had a regular job before; her education ended early, the Bulgarian economy is weak and the Roma face intense discrimination from the ethnic Bulgarian population. She saw starting her own business as a way of taking control of her future and providing for herself and her children.

loans.use: Working capital.  Equipment.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 42-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have scant access to credit.

Under the communist state, Ivan worked in a state-owned automobile parts factory in Sliven. When the state support ended for this factory, the company closed and Ivan was displaced. Ivan has been out of work for the majority of the last decade, as most heavy industry has closed down in Bulgaria. His plan is to become a taxi driver. He recently pooled enough money together from family and friends to partially purchase a used car. With this loan, he will be able to purchase it outright from its owner, paint it appropriately, and make several critical repairs. Ivan is eager to get his taxi business underway, so that he can work as much as he wants. He is married with several children and looks forward to “supporting them as I should.”

loans.use: Equipment and renovations to taxi.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Mikhail

texts.en:
Mikhail is a 31-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Mikhail is married with two kids (6 and 13 years old) and previously supported his family as a member of a traveling band.

Mikhail is now starting a hot sandwich shop so that he can have a more reliable income and spend more time at home in Sliven with his family. As you can see in the photo, he’s already put together his stand and has already begun selling some items. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase some of the equipment he needs as well as inventory. He is a little bit nervous about taking on the debt, but is confident he’ll be able to make the business successful through sheer effort.

loans.use: Capital equipment and working capital.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Vassil

texts.en:
Vassil is a 23-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Vassil is married with one child.

Vassil has shown musical talent since he was a child. Recently, a spot opened up on a Roma band for a drum player. Vassil has been accepted to the band as long as he can raise funds to purchase his instruments. The band plays at Roma weddings and events across the Balkans – particularly Bulgaria, Romania and Macedonia – as well as at tourist spots along the Black Sea coast in the summer. Vassil sees this as a way to escape the poverty of the Roma ghetto in Sliven and begin to properly support his family. He is excited about the travel it represents, but already laments the time away from his wife and child. When walking around his neighborhood, I asked him if he was certain it was worth it. He looked at me and said, “Look around. Wouldn’t you want more than this for your family?” Onward, Vassil.

loans.use: Drums

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a 24-year-old woman from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Angelina is married with two kids. Her husband is in a Roma traveling band and is rarely at home.

Angelina is currently opening a small café in the Roma quarter, where she will predominately be selling pre-packaged foods and pork sandwiches. She has a great attitude and is excited about the financial lift this will bring to her family. In Bulgaria, parents are expected to purchase their children’s textbooks, which for many is not economically possible. Next year, however, her hope is that this will change for her children.

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Gyunaydan

texts.en:
Gyunaydan is a 38-year-old man from the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria. The Roma, commonly referred to as Gypsies, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of southeastern Europe and typically have no or little access to credit. Gyunaydan is married with two kids (17 and 18).

Until recently, Gyunaydan worked at a large bread factory in Sliven. Two months ago, however, he started up a bakery in the Roma quarter. Out of his own kitchen, he makes a variety of Bulgarian bread foods – banitzas, mekitzas, pizza – and sells them from a window in the front of his house. We hadn’t met Gyunaydan when he started this, so he has had to make do without credit thus far. This loan will enable him to build out his equipment and expand, since there’s only so much you can do with a small oven. Once he can produce more, his plan is to sell through some of the small grocery stores in town to increase his distribution.

loans.use: Capital equipment

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B. is employed as a gardner and volunteers on the weekends tending the beautiful gardens at Life in Africa's WE Center. In this way he earns the points that allow him to obtain LiA community benefits like micro-loans.

John was not displaced by war as most LiA members were, but by poverty. His family at home in Western Uganda was very large and there was no money to be had for things like education. But he was smart and knew that if he wanted a future he would need to leave the poverty of the village and he found his way to Kampala. He has a natural gift for growing things and has been able to earn his living by working in the gardens of various expatriates over the past few years.

He has been diligent and saved so that he could buy a piece of property. On it is a partly finished house where he now resides. John longs to have a family of his own now that he has stable means to support one, but culture dictates that he must finish his house before he marries and starts having children. The LiA community has agreed to guarantee a small loan for this purpose in the amount of shs. 800,000.

Below is his budget in full:

1- Cement 20 bags @ 18,000/= --------- 360,000/=

2- Sand 4 trips @ 70,000/= --------- 280,000/=

3- Transport ------------------- 80,000/=

4- wire mesh for ceiling -------- 60,000/=

5- others----- -------- ----- - 20,000/=

6- Total........................1,000,000

John has shs. 200,000 in savings to add to the loan for completing this budget. He also has some building skills himself, so he will be working hand in hand with the person assisting him and thus be able to save on labor costs.

loans.use: Housing Construction

payments.comment:
Dear Kiva Lenders to Life in Africa borrowers in Uganda,

On behalf of Life in Africa's WE Center Kampala community I offer an apology for the irregularities in posting our borrower repayments and journal updates to the Kiva website over the past several months. In an effort to model a high standard of the transparency we operating in Africa should uphold online, this rather long message contains details that are relevant to helping you understand what's already happened, and what's happening now in the Life in Africa community with regard to this issue. Rest assured, Kiva staff are aware of these issues and some have personally met, face to face, a number of the personalities involved. We at LiA feel it's now high time to let you - our valued lenders - in on the sensitive nature of the challenges we've been dealing with.

In September 2006, some LiA community members tasked to manage the loan program and the Invisible Children bracelet campaign resigned amidst accusations of mismanagement from other members in the Life in Africa community. In the process, which was painful but arguably very healthy for the community in important ways, a laptop was stolen that included the records for both programs, the WE Center was closed for 2 weeks, and management of the invisible children project shifted to another site, taking 35 (of 80) Life in Africa members involved in the project with them to be full time employees. Among the staff lost during all the disruption at that time included 4 of 7 people trained to process and manage LiA member loans. Those who were left with loans training were heaped with mountains of new community management responsibilities on their plates. Everything related to the loans program seemed upside down and got out of synch for a while.

Most LiA borrowers experienced a 1-3 month period after the September events when payments due to them from the Invisible Children bracelet project were delayed. Many fell into arrears on their loans at that time. In most (but not all) of those cases, those arrears have now been paid up to date. However, in the wake of September's disruption, the paper files for the loan program were also left in disarray and the computerized records were gone. It took over 3 months for David Ewaku, a Life in Africa Board Member, to reconstruct the records and get the partnerships with Kiva (esp. online) and Invisible Children somewhat back on track, so that by January 2007 loan payments were coming in smoothly again.

Unfortunately, part of why it took so long was that David fell very ill and has been in and out of hospital since November. By then, however, we had hired a recent MBA grad with experience in microfinance as full time accounts manager for the Life in Africa community. Yet another disaster - the new accounts manager took over David's updated loan program records, and proceeded through professional incompetence to make a complete mess of them over the next 4 months. She resigned in mid-March 2007 after receiving a warning letter from the community operations team about her performance. We now find ourselves consulting 3 different sources of information that are riddled with holes and mistakes in order to get an accurate picture of what our borrowers have actually paid.

After a recent telephone discussion with Kiva staff about the apparent arrears in our loan portfolio, and with me hosting meetings in my home and participating in an advisory team for organizing Kiva's forthcoming ground-truthing efforts in East Africa this past week, we at LiA have been feeling a very keen sense of urgency about updating our payments on the Kiva website. Luckily, the community has Grace - our star community leader/borrower who is featured in the PBS Frontline segment about Kiva. Over the past 2 years, she has dedicated her heart and soul to uplifting Life in Africa's communities in both Kampala and Gulu. Though she is no accountant, Grace Ayaa has now committed herself to taking the LiA loan program's administrative challenges by the horns.

Over the past 2 weeks Grace has been working with a small group of community members to figure out how to reconstruct the community's loan program records, so that more than one person understands the process that's been used and everyone can agree on the final updated report. I can see she is very determined to do this transparently and am grateful on behalf of the LiA community to Grace for the leadership she's investing in getting our payment and loan tracking system straight and systemized once and for all. In fact, she had hoped to finish everything before leaving for a short trip to Gulu this morning. Instead, Grace and her group of committee members have asked me to appeal directly for lenders' patience. They feel that getting this sorted out right means it should not be approached in haste - they need more time to talk to the borrowers one by one to compare their records & recollections with the office records to get an accurate final picture of where each member stands.

PLEASE NOTE: To avoid that ALL of our members' online records are negatively affected any further by this internal administrative crisis, we are today marking all scheduled member loan payments as paid up to this month on the Kiva website. The amount paid on each account has been determined by the Kiva bulk-payments feature as the scheduled amount outstanding due to Kiva. Our community has, after all, guaranteed that each of these loans will be fully repaid to the lenders, regardless of each borrower's actual performance. Nonetheless, once we have all of this sorted out, we will update all of you (hopefully with next month's payments) on the accurate situation for your borrower with a link to the full and actual member repayment records for all loans guaranteed by the LiA community in 2006. In the cases where payments posted on Kiva were already up to date, I have posted a $1 payment to be able to alert all of our lenders to this message.

I humbly hope you can forgive us at LiA for not communicating with lenders earlier about the challenges we've faced in keeping the payments on Kiva accurately recorded, and thank you for your continued patience as the community works in good faith to get the mess sorted out. It is likely Kiva will be sending a Kiva Fellow to work with us during the summer months, which - combined with the lessons we've already learned - will undoubtedly help us stay on a better track as we now begin raising loan funds for more members in both Kampala and Gulu.

Meanwhile, any lenders with constructive support to offer, or with an interest in volunteering with our microfinance program in Uganda, are most welcome to join us in dialogue at the Omidyar.net communuty and contact Grace Ayaa online at http://www.omidyar.net/group/lia/. You can also see an interview with Grace about the challenges of leading the LiA community at http://www.youtube.com/v/KhqXHgl7j-k.

Many thanks again for the lasting impact you have made on our member's life, and on our community's ability to learn how to enable and manage access to micro-loans for our members.

Sincerely

Christina Jordan
Founder & Managing Director
Life in Africa - WE Centers Uganda
http://www.LifeInAfrica.com

P.S. - Watch out for Life in Africa borrowers from WE Center Gulu in Northern Uganda, coming online with loan applications at kiva within the next 2 weeks. There is a recently made student movie about the WE Center Gulu community building activities LiA started there in August 2007 at http://www.youtube.com/v/maG0Hd9jh6o - Enjoy!

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a responsibly married woman with three children. She came to Kampala in 1995 when situation in Northern Uganda was not good to live in due to conflicts, which escalated to date. She left the village and came to settle in the Acholi quarters.

While in the Acholi quarter, she engaged in rock quarrying where she tried to squeek out a living for a long time and things were not appealing at all! Even working condition was not good since one is always exposed to the sunshine the whole day!
