Not only the sun was a problem but also danger of stones falling and wounding many who are involved in the activity of this nature.

Like Moses led the people of Israel from Egypt to a promised land, so is Life in Africa. She came to learn about Life in Africa foundation from people of good heart who introduced her and eventually joined as a bracelet maker. She is doing well with bracelets and also quite sustaining but this has not solved all her problems because where Margaret lives in Acholi Quarters she is renting - in spite of the fact that she owns a piece of land given to her by the king of Buganda (he gave parcels of the entire hill where the stone quarry lies to the displaced Acholi living there).

For months she has been thinking of building at least a two-roomed house so that she could save her rent money each month. With those savings, she'd eventually like to build a permanent family house in her District, should there one day be opportunity of going back there some day.

Margaret has saved and 100,000/= and has also recently started selling beads she makes from paper at home through the LiA CAN! export coop, which has increased her monthly income to a point that she feels comfortable servicing a loan. Therefore she is seeking loan amount of 800,000/= to top up her saving so that she can take this big step of building her own home. Below is her budget:

1000 bricks @ 50 ……….......50,000/=

15 bags of cement @ 18,000.270,000/=

1 trip of sand@ 60,000/- ..60,000/=

12 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 11,000 = 1320 00/=

20 roofing poles @ 1400...28,000/=

Labor.....................150,000/=

2doors @ 30,000 ......... 60,000/=

2 windows @ 15000/=.......30,000/=

Transport.................70,000/=

Kcc charges...............10,000/=

Water.....................10,000/=

Roofing nails 2kgs @ 5000.10,000/=

Other nails 2kgs @ 3000...6,000/

Other expenses...........14,000/=

-Total ...................900,000

loans.use: construction materials and labor

loans.name: Balex

texts.en:
O. Balex came to Kampala in 0ctober 2004 when his elder brother was killed by rebels and their houses and properties burnt down! As a result he had to run away from Northern Uganda to Kampala for the safety of his life. Things have not been so favorable for him in Kampala, which pushed him to take up a security job that bears nothing but risks of life! Not forgetting the mega income.

By God’s grace Balex came across life in Africa, which he joined as a part-time gardener, and that became a great opportunity for him. Along side his gardening work, Balex has also been involved in arts and crafts production and quality control. He's also been able to join the Internet4Change program, where he's learning how to create blogs and loan applications for other members. In October, he was offered a full time position at Life in Africa as an assistant to the newly appointed Director of Ugandan Communities (Kiva borrower Grace Ayaa). After years of feeling alone and hopeless in life, young Balex now has direction and purpose.

As an ambition, Balex has saved 200,000/= that he plans to use for building a three roomed family house on a plot of land that he acquired from the king of Buganda. This is intended to solve the pressure from the landlord and also help him provide for his future wife and children. To complete this project, Balex is seeking a loan amount of 800,000/=.

Below is his budget in detail.

15 bags of cement @ 18,000/= .........270,000/=

1500 bricks @ 50/= ....................75,000/=

2 trips of sand and transport@ 60,000.120,000/=

Labor ................................250,000/=

12 iron sheets of 32 gauge @ 11,000...123,000/=

20 roofing timbers @ 5000.............100,000/=

Lime 4 bags @ 18,000...................72,000/=

2 wooden doors @ 50,000...............100,000/=

2 glass windows @ 50,000/.............100,000/=

2kgs of roofing nails @ 5000...........10,000/=

2kgs of 6icn nails @ 3000................6000/=

Water @ ...............................10,000/=

City Council charges....................5,000/=

Other transport costs..................21,000/=

Total...............................1,000,000/=

loans.use: Building materials and labor

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
My name is Alejandro V.. I have been working for 40 years as a carpenter. I love this job, and I learned it from my father. From that time I have made several types of wood furniture, like kitchens, doors and cabinets. I feel a great satisfaction because I had the opportunity to provide a college education to my son, thanks to this business. But I still have responsibilities with my family and new projects to make.

I would like to start making wood moldings. There is a good demand in the local market, but I need to buy new machinery to make them. This is why I require an industrial winch. I’m planning to obtain this equipment through a loan of $1200 and to pay back in a term of 1 year. With this new machinery I can make a new product, grow the business, and give a better life to my family

Spanish

Mi nombre es Alejandro V. me dedico a la carpintería desde hace mas de 40 años siento un gusto especial por este oficio, el cual aprendí de mi padre, desde ese tiempo he fabricado varias clases de muebles de madera así como cocinas, puertas y gabinetes. Siento un a gran satisfacción por haber proporcionado una carrera profesional a mi hijo gracias a este negocio, pero aun tengo responsabilidades con mi familia y nuevos proyectos que cumplir, como la elaboración de molduras de madera, las cuales requieren de un torno Industrial el cual planeo conseguir a través de un préstamo de $1200.00 y pagarlos en un plazo de 1 año, con ello podré elaborar un producto diferente en el mercado, el cual tiene mucha demanda y proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida para mi familia.

loans.use: buy machinery and raw materials

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria M. M. is a single mother. She has a small coffee shop inside an elementary school here in Nuevo Laredo. Her menu is tacos, burritos, corn, juice, soda and some snacks, and she sells her food to the students at lunch time. She wants to incorporate more healthy food for the students instead of only snacks, and this is why she is applying for a loan of $900. With this money she will buy more ingredients to make healthy snacks and give a better option to the students and this will also increase her family income.

Español

La Sra. Candelaria Martínez Martínez es Madre soltera y tiene una pequeña tiendita en una escuela primaria de Nuevo Laredo en la cual les vende alimentos a los estudiantes (como tacos, lonches, fritos, elotes, refrescos, jugos y etc.) en la hora de recreo. Ella quiere elaborar comida más saludable para los estudiantes de la escuela y con esto generar un mejor ingreso para su familia, incrementando sus ventas y dando mejores opciones de alimentación a los estudiantes, por ello solicita un préstamo de $900.00 con los cuales pretende comprar los ingredientes para su proyecto. Este crédito piensa pagarlo en un año y generar un mejor ingreso familiar.

loans.use: healthy food

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a married mother of three who works in Guayaquil, Ecuador running a small restaurant which serves traditional Ecuadorian breakfast, lunch and afternoon snack called “merienda.” Ms. D. was faced with starting her own business to bring in extra income or else her family would surely go hungry. Because her husband only contributes a modest salary, Vera relied on her mother who lives in New York to send money, so that this young entrepreneur could open her restaurant. It has been twelve years, and slowly Vera’s place has grown. Her clients are very loyal, as she has them hooked on her tasty breakfasts. Above all, Ms. D. says that she loves her job because she gets do to what she loves – cook and make people happy. She employs three people who are all single mothers, and they all work together from 7a.m. until 9p.m. at "La Flipper" together. Vera is applying for this loan so that she can purchase stock inventory like rice, sugar, oil as well as utensils like dishes and pots. If she buys in cash, she can receive big discounts from the wholesalers, instead of buying each item separately on a daily basis. Vera has taken out loans from loan sharks in the past who charge 20% monthly, and now she has been given a unique opportunity to grow her business and support her family affordably.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Vera is applying for this loan so that she can purchase stock inventory like rice, sugar, oil as well as utensils like dishes and pots.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is a married woman, has three children and she isdistinguished by being active and hard working. She started her business three years ago. She likes cooking and prepares unbeleivable “Tamales." In order to support to her husband with the family’s expenses, she needed to generate an adittional income because her husband is a merchant in the flea market and his income is variable. For that reason, her business is becoming important to her family and is contributing and supporting the education of her son, who is in high school. She needs a loan of $ 250 USD to be able to supply the raw materials such as meat, sheets corn, spices and condiments in order to be prepare and be able to supply her clients who have increased their orders this next season. She is requesting a 3-6 months term to pay back her loan.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Adriana es una mujer casada que tiene tres hijos y se distingue por ser muy activa y trabajadora. Hace tres años que ella inició su negocio de elaboración de tamales y venta de zapatos teniendo como objetivo ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que tenia necesidad de generar ingresos adicionales, pues su esposo es comerciante en los mercados rodantes y tiene ingresos que son muy variables y es por ello que su negocio se ha vuelto importante para la familia pues así complementan los gastos y contribuyen a la educación de su hijo que esta estudiando la preparatoria. Actualmente ella tiene la necesidad de un préstamo por $ 250 USD para poder comprar las materias primas como carne, hojas para tamal, especies y condimentos, así como para comprar zapatos para estar preparada y poder surtir los pedidos que se incrementan en esta próxima temporada. Esta solicitando un plazo para pagar su crédito de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Ana Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Ana María is married and has two little children. Her husband is a driver and had problems because his salary was not enough to cover the family expenses. The kids are studying at the elementary school and in order to suppourt them and her husband, she decided to start her own business selling Tupperware products three years ago. Her business has been growing and she continues to satisfy her clients. She knows during November and December her sales will increase and for that reason she needs a loan by $ 250 USD to buy merchandise and be able to supply the orders of her clients, the term to repay the loan is 3-6 months.

** "This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Ana María esta casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños, su esposo es chofer de transportes y tenía problemas pues no le pagaban lo suficiente en su trabajo y no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos de la familia, ya que sus hijos acuden a la escuela primaria y ante esta situación ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de tupperware desde hace tres años, el cual ha hecho crecer debido a la buena aceptación entre sus clientes. Pensando en que Noviembre y Diciembre son los meses en que se incrementan sus ventas, Ana María esta requiriendo un préstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar mercancías para poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, además el plazo que solicita para liquidar el crédito es de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Eight years ago, Leticia started her own small business of selling shoes and jewelery. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker and he earns a variable salary and sometimes it was not enough to cover all the family expenses and for that reason she decided to start her business to support her husband with the family maintenance. When she started her business, she only offered her products among her family and friends. Later she was including her neighbors and everybody who wanted her products. The highest season sale is coming and she wants to be prepare to take all the orders of her clients. This is the reason why she requires a loan by $250 USD to buy shoes and jewelry, she is going to pay back in a term of 3-6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Hace ocho años que Leticia inició su propio negocio de venta de zapatos y joyería, ella esta casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo es albañil y trabaja en la obra de construcción, pero como sus ingresos son variables en ocasiones resultaban insuficientes para costear todos los gastos de la familia, esa fue la razón por la que decidió iniciar su negocio para apoyar a su esposo en el mantenimiento de la familia. Cuando inició su negocio solamente ofrecía sus productos entre sus familiares y amistades y con el paso del tiempo fue extendiéndose con sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta por iniciar la temporada de ventas altas y es por eso que quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientes, para ello que requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 USD para comprar zapatos y joyas, para pagar en un plazo de 3-6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Servando

texts.en:
In February of 2004, Servando was unemployed. He is a carpenter but works many other jobs as well for other companies. One friend invited him to start the natural products sales. This was something new for him but he decided to try. Fortunately everything was good and the customers were convinced about the quality of the products he recommends to everybody. His portfolio of clients is increasing and he feels so proud with his achievements. However, he always wanted to work like a carpenter so with her job as a salesman of natural products he can saved some money and in December of 2005 he will enter in a partnership with another person and both will open their own business as carpenters and they are working building furniture. Now he has two jobs and Servando is requesting a loan of US$ 475 payable in 4 months at least, and with this loan he could buy raw materials.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

En Febrero de 2004 Servando estaba desempleado, y no lograba contratarse él es carpintero de oficio, pero siempre había trabajado empleado en otros talleres. No lograba contratarse y un amigo lo invito a vender Productos Naturales, era algo nuevo para él, pero decidió probar, afortunadamente le fue bien, y convencido de la calidad de los productos los recomienda ampliamente. Su cartera de clientes se ha incrementado considerablemente, y se siente satisfecho con los resultados. Sin embargo siempre estaba añorando su oficio de carpintero, fue así como gracias a los productos naturales logro hacerse de unos ahorros y en Diciembre de 2005 se asocio con otra persona para montar una carpintería, en donde se fabrican muebles a la orden. Como en los 2 negocios es su patrón ahora alterna su tiempo entre las ventas y su negocio de carpintería. Esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de US$ 475 que piensa pagar en 4 meses, este préstamo lo utilizaría para compara madera, pegamento, clavos, para poder fabricar piezas y ofrecerlas para su venta. Este negocio se ve favorecido en el mes de Diciembre, pues es cuando la gente invierte para comprar muebles para su hogar; por lo que Servando quiere estar preparado y poder aprovechar esta temporada.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Alma Nelly

texts.en:
Alma has two sons that help her to run her business. She has worked eleven years with her business and her business is electronics devices and videos games sales. These video games are in great demand for people, especially kids. Alma purchases a great part of her merchandise in the United States of America because she has the option to travel there because it is near to Nuevo Leon. Another benefit of buying in the USA is better prices than in Mexico so she can competes with their products in Mexico and obtain more income. Alma is requesting a loan of $ 750 to purchase merchandise this season because she knows that her demand will increase this Christmas due her historic analysis and experience. Alma offer to pay back this loan in four months and also she is very sure that all her merchandise will be sold because she has a lot of clients that ask her for more, better and newer video games.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Alma tiene dos hijos y ellos antes le ayudaban en el negocio, con el que ya tiene 11 años. Su negocio es vender aparatos electrónicos y video juegos, estos últimos son muy demandados por las personas en especialmente la gente joven y los niños. Alma compra gran parte de su mercadería de los Estados Unidos, ya que tiene la opción de viajar debido a la cercanía con ese país, además comprando en EE.UU. los precios que obtiene por los artefactos y por los video juegos son muy bueno y así puede competir con sus productos en México y obtener utilidades. Alma esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 750 para comprar mercancía en estas fechas, ya que para navidad, la demanda de video juegos se incrementa según sus estudios históricos de su demanda. Ella ofrece pagar el crédito en 4 meses y esta segura que venderá toda la mercancía que adquiera por que ya tiene muchos clientes fijos que le comentaron su necesidad de más, mejores y nuevos video juegos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
My name is Javier Isidoro O.. I’m the owner of a corner store, which is my only revenue source for me and my family.

I had 10 years of experience in the field and in this period my profits have been very good. I would like to have more products in my store and give a better service to my customers in this popular neighborhood where the people appreciate me a lot.

I'm asking for loan of $600 which I will pay back in 1 year. With this money I will buy different products and my customers will have more buying options.

Español

Mi nombre es Javier Isidoro O., soy dueño de una pequeña tienda, la cual es la única fuente de ingreso para mi y mi familia.

Tengo 10 años de experiencia en el campo, sin embargo, en este tiempo a pesar de que mis ingresos han sido buenos quiero tener mas variedad de producto para mis clientes y brindarles un servicio, en esta vecindario tan popular y en donde la gente me aprecia mucho, por lo cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $600.00 el cual pienso pagar en un lapso de un 1 año, con este importe compraré productos diferentes y mis clientes tendrán más opciones de compra.

loans.use: different products

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
My name is Mrs.Domitila V. Verastegui. I’m a very entrepreneurial person and I love to sell. I’m the kind of person who says that: “there isn’t any age limit to reach your goals, so it doesn’t matter if you are very young or if you are an older person. You can reach your goals anytime if you work hard to get it”. Now I have in mind to increase the number of shoe models and offer to my clients different kinds of shoes. That’s why I’m asking for a loan of $600.00 to increase the shoe models and have some stock. I’m planning to pay back the loan in one year on a monthly basis.

Español

Mi nombre es Sra. Domitila V. Verastegui, soy una persona muy emprendedora y me encanta vender. Yo soy de las clases de persona que dicen: “No hay limite de edad para alcanzar tus metas, así que no importa si eres muy joven o una persona de edad, en cualquier momento tu puedes cumplir tus metas si trabajas duro”.por eso ahora tengo en mente incrementar el numero de modelos de zapato y ofrecer a mis clientes diferente clase de zapato, por lo cual estoy solicitando un préstamo de $600.00 para incrementar los modelos de zapato y tener en stock, planeo pagar mensualmente durante un año.

loans.use: buy different shoe models

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
My name is Oscar P.. I sell shoes and seasonal products since 2000 in “El Oriente” community, close to Nuevo Laredo. I would like to have more products to sell in my small store. I want to offer basics items, like: bath soap, laundry detergent, toothpaste, etc. I sell my products in my community and give them a very good price because there isn’t any other store near here and the people have to drive or walk long distances to buy these kinds of products. That is the reason why I’m asking for a loan of $600. With this amount I will buy these products and offer them to the people of the community.

Español

Mi nombre es Oscar P., vendo zapatos desde hace 5 años en La comunidad Oriente, cerca de Nuevo Laredo. Me gustaría tener más productos que vender en mi pequeña tienda. Quiero ofrecer productos básicos como: jabón de baño, detergente, pasta de dientes, etc. En mi comunidad y dar el mejor precio, porque no hay tiendas cercanas que vendan esos productos y la gente tiene que manejar o caminar distancias largas para poder conseguirlos, esa es la razón principal de la solicitud de mi crédito por $600.00, con este importe pretendo comprar Esos productos y ofrecerlos a la comunidad.

loans.use: different basic products

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.en:
Maria Graciela is married and has two sons. She has a shoe sales business and has more than six years with the business. She started her business due her economic situation. She needed to start her own business in order to suppourt her family and educate her two sons. She has the opportunity to travel frequently to Moroleon and this city is one of the most competitive cities in Mexico in leather also in shoes. Buying there, she could obtain a great margin of utilities selling her merchandise in Nuevo Leon. Maria Graciela is requesting for a loan of US$ 650 to purchase merchandise and take advantage of this change of season and Christmas. She comments that she will pay this loan in six months at least, and if she gets this opportunity she could increase her sales and also her incomes.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Graciela esta casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ya tiene en este negocio más de seis años, inicio en este negocio por la necesidad económica y tenia que aportar ingresos para los gastos familiares y para poder vivir y educar a sus hijos. Comenzó en este negocio por que ella tiene la facilidad de ir a Moroleón muy a menudo y en esa ciudad es una de las más competitivas en artículos de piel y zapatos en general, por ello comprando allá puede obtener utilidades vendiendo los zapatos en Nuevo León, ya que son de buena calidad y a buen precio, por ello Maria Graciela esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 650 para comprar mercancía y poder vender en este cambio de temporada y época de navideña. Comenta que pagará este crédito en 6 meses y que si le brindan esa oportunidad podrá incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Hello, my Name is Maria Hermila D. León Ochoa. I sell delicious beef tamales in Nuevo Laredo and hot chocolate. I also sell tacos and soda. This is my only way of living and my small business has been growing every day. That is why I’m asking for a 900 loan, because I would like to invest that money in more food ingredients and rent a small commercial space. With this commercial location I will increase my food sales and revenues that will give my family better living conditions.

Español

Hola, mi nombre es Maria Hermila D. León Ochoa, Vendo deliciosos tamales D. carne en Nuevo Laredo y chocolate caliente, también vendo tacos y refrescos, esta es la única fuente D. ingreso con la que cuento y mi negocio crece día con día.

Por eso estoy solicitando un préstamo D. $900.00 ya que me gustaría invertirlo en ingredientes para comida y rentar un local, para establecerme ahí, poder incrementar las ventas e ingresos y darle mejores condiciones D. vida a mi familia.

loans.name: Mirna Nobella

texts.en:
My name is Mirna M. and my business is to manufacture bed linens. I have been in business for 3 years, and my clients favor the quality of my product. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and production capacity. I'd like to to remodel my home and support my family.

Mi nombre es Mirna M. me dedico a la fabricacion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, mi negocio me genera ingresos para mantener a mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi hogar y mantener a mi familia.

loans.name: Silvia Isabel

My name is Silvia S. I am in the business of making bed linens. I have been having my business for 2 years. My business is to generate income to support my family. My daughters help me in the business as well. My goal is to increase my inventory and production line. My goal is to be able to remodel my house, buy a new machine to cook, and to sustain my family.

Mi nombre es Silvia S. me dedico a la produccion y venta de ropa para camas, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, tengo la ayuda de una de mis hijas para la venta de mi producto, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para una mejor produccion y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi casa, comprar una maquina nueva de cocer y sustentar mi familia.

My name is Holy H., and I'm dedicated on sale of products of popular consumption, has my business for 3 years. My business generates income to me for the sustenance of my family. My goal is to increase my inventory to have a greater assortment of product to sell. I'd like to give my son an education.

Mi nombre es Santos H., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi clientela es muy buena ya que yo personalmente los atiendo y son los vecinos de mi colonia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de productos y tener mas surtido mi negocio con las ganancias que obtenga quiero acondicionar mejor mi negocio y darles estudio a mi hijo.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.en:
Maria Virginia is married and has two sons. She has had her business for 12 years and her sons asisst her in this business. 12 years ago, she had to begin working because she had to help with the family expenses. She loves to cook and decided to open a small bakery that has been doing very well. As time has passed her business has grown and based on this she strongly believes it will continue growing. She hopes in time to be a successful female entrepreneur and leave her sons a business which could help them and continue growing. For this reason she is requesting a loan of US$ 1,200 that she offers to pay back in six months. With this loan she will purchase raw materials for her bakery and will be prepared for the upcoming months which, in her experience, are the best of the year.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Maria Virginia esta casada y tiene dos hijos, ya tiene con su negocio 12 años y la ayudan en el negocio sus hijos. Hace 12 años ella se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder tener el sustento de la familia y como le gusta mucho la repostería, decidió abrir un pequeño negocio de venta de pan y pasteles que a la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Con el paso del tiempo el negocio ha ido creciendo y fortaleciéndose y por ello Maria Virginia tiene muchas expectativas de seguir creciendo y llegar a ser en algún momento una mujer emprendedora exitosa y dejarles a sus hijos un patrimonio y un negocio del cual puedan ellos continuar y salir adelante económicamente. Por ello esta solicitando un crédito por US$ 1,200 que ofrece pagarlos en 6 meses y lo usará para comprar materia prima para la panadería y estar lista para estos meses que según su experiencia son los mejores del año.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina R. Marquez has a small butcher shop. Every day her sons help her in the business. She started selling groceries but then she changed to sell meat. She started the business 3 years ago. The business is growing and running very well, that's why the business needs a bigger freezer. This new freezer will give a better customer service and more meat sales.

Mrs.Evangelina R. needs a bigger freezer because the current one is very small and is not working very well. Mrs Evangelina knows that most important for a butcher shop is a good freezer. She is asking for a loan of $1200. With this money she plans to buy the freezer. Mrs Evangelina R. wants to pay back in 1 year.

Español

La Sra. Evangelina R. Marquez tiene una pequeña Carnicería. Sus Hijos la ayudan en el negocio, ella comenzó vendiendo abarrotes y luego cambio a la venta de carne. El negocio va bien y va creciendo, por lo cual necesita un congelador mas grande y mejor. Este nuevo Congelador proporcionaría un mejor servicio a los clientes y mayores venta de Carne razón por la cual la Sra. Evangelina R. necesita para su negocio un congelador nuevo, con mayor capacidad y con mejor funcionamiento, ella sabe que lo mas importante para un a carnicería es un buen congelador. Ella solicita un préstamo de $1200.00, con este importe planea comprar un congelador nuevo con mayor capacidad, planea pagarlo mensualmente durante un año.

loans.use: new freezer

loans.name: Edwin Tomas

texts.en:
My name is Edwin and I sell new clothes such as blouses, shirts, boy's clothing,and underclothes. I have been in business for 1 year, whihc is located in Danli. My wife helps me with my business. We are able to grow with the income that we have, however we want to re-construct our house.

Me llamo Edwin y me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, ropa de niño y ropa interior, mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 1 año y esta ubicado en uno de los boulevares de Danli. El negocio es familiar es decir mi esposa me ayuda a vender. Con los ingresos que tenemos de las ventas hemos podido hacer crecer nuestro negocio un poco mas, pero ahora queremos construir nuestra casa, por eso necesitamos invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para incrementar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de camisas, blusas, ropa interior y otros.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is Idalia of the Carmen and my business is in the sale of breakfast, lunch and snacks. I have been in business for 3 years and have support of my sister. My business generates income to sustain my family. My goal is to be able to increase my inventory and to have a greater food sales. I'd like to remodel my business and support my family.

Mi nombre es Idalia del Carmen A. me dedico a la produccion y venta de desayunos, almuerzos y golosinas, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hermana para la venta de la comida, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es poder incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta de comida y con los ingresos que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio y sustentar a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de carne de cerdo y pollo, aceite, manteca, sal, especias, vegetales, tortillas, mantequilla, queso, huevos, refrescos, platos desechables, salsa de tomate, mayonesa, mostaza

loans.name: Nolvia Maribel

texts.en:
My business is located on the Democracia Boulevard in the city of Danli. I am the single mother of a five year old boy. I have invested some money in the business of selling clothing. I have done well in this business so far. the holiday months are good for increased sales. This loan will go to purchasing various clothing items like pants, dresses, intimate apparell, etc.

Tengo mi negocio ubicado en el Boulevard la Democracia en la ciudad de Danli, soy madre soltera mi hijo tiene cinco años de edad, por lo que decidi invertir algo de dinero y me ha ido bien en el negocio. En estos meses es cuando mas ventas hay por lo que necesito hacer una buena inversion para tener ropa variada para satisfacer a mis clientes.

loans.use: Compra de pantalones, vestidos de niña, camisetas, ropa interior y otros

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is separated and has one son. He had the opportunity to study a technical career in electronics. When he divorced from his wife, he had to care for his son and could not find a job. He thought, and decided to open his own business doing what he knew how to do. 10 years ago he started the business of repairing machines like televisions and washing machines, etc. Since he didn't have to make a large investment, it seemed at that moment sensible to open his business at home, and quickly soon after he had more and more clients. Now his business has grown and is growing, and as a result he needs to have a stock of pieces and spare parts to repair the equipment that people bring to him. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $750 which he offers to pay back in 6 months.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Rodrigo esta separado y tiene un hijo. Tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera técnica en electrónica, al separarse de su esposa quedó a cargo de su único hijo y como no conseguía empleo, pensó y decidió en abrir su propio negocio en lo que sabía hacer y fue eso lo que hizo, hace 10 años atrás empezó en el negocio de reparación de televisores, lavadoras, refrigeradoras, etc. Como no tenía que hacer mucha inversión le fue en su momento sencillo abrir su taller en su propia casa y de ahí en adelante fue teniendo muchos clientes. Ahora como su negocio a mejorado el necesita obtener un stock de piezas y refacciones para los equipos que le lleven a reparar, por ello esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 750 que promete pagarlos en 6 meses.

loans.use: To purchase pieces and spare parts

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.en:
My name is Gloria C. and I manufacture and sell tortillas. I also sell chocolate bananas. I have had my business for four years. My children help me package my products. I already have a good customer base and I sell in my neighborhood. My business generates income for me to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and have a greater production of tortillas. The profits could allow me to remodel the tortilla production area, support my family and provide for the education of my children.

Loan Use: Purchase corn flour, salt, lime, water, coal, firewood, matches, bananas, chocolate

In 1987 he had to support his family and he did not have sufficient economic resources to do so, so he decided to open his own business. Queretaro’s weather is cold most of the year, and he saw the opportunity to start selling socks. His business was a success, he sold his products in a popular market and his wife joined the business to help in sales. Then he opened another small place in a different popular market. In this way, his business has continued growing and he feels happy. He does not have enough money to invest in more merchandise to offer his clients. For this reason he is requesting a loan of US $550, and with this loan he will purchase more merchandise and a variety of products to offer his clients, and have more sales and a greater income as well.

loans.name: Fiacre Gabriel

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by three entrepreneurs from the Dikasofoor Association in the village of Diouru. Their representative, Fiacre Gabriel D., gave us the following business plan description:

“Senegal has about 10 million inhabitants, of which over half are youth. The problem of unemployment is becoming ever more pressing. Cities are being invaded by this segment of the population in search of work. Immigration is becoming the most popular recourse for young people, but it has not proven to be the best solution.

The Dikasofoor Association, conscious of the problem, has decided to take up the raising and commerce of poultry. The products of poultry farming are highly prized among the restaurants, hotels and households of Senegal. This activity will allow the members of the association to contribute to socio-economic development and resolve the problem of unemployment. The goal of the project is to keep young people in their home region, fight poverty and reduce violence by establishing a profitable, revenue-generating activity.

The business activity consists of buying chicks, raising them and selling them at the market, to restaurants or to individual households. This work will be done as a team. One member will take charge of seeking out clients, and the two others will take charge of raising the chickens. In order to closely monitor the development of the chicks, a group meeting will be held each week. Another meeting to make the monthly loan repayment installments will be held each month. Profits from this activity will go to the Association’s account.”

Original French:

"Le Sénégal est peuplé d’environ 10.000.000 habitants. La jeunesse représente plus de la moitié. La demande d’emploi connaît des proportions de plus en plus importante. Les villes sont envahies par cette couche de la population à la recherche du travail. L’immigration devient la solution la plus prisée par les jeunes mais elle ne se révèle pas colle la meilleure solution.

L’association Dikasofoor, consciente du problème, décide de se lancer dans l’élevage et le commerce de la volaille. Les produits de l’aviculture sont très prisés au Sénégal notamment dans le domaine de la restauration, des hôtels et chez les particuliers. Cette activité permettra la réinsertion des membres de l’association dans le développement socio-économique et résoudre le problème de chômage. Le projet a pour objectif de fixer la jeunesse dans son milieu, à lutter contre la pauvreté et réduire les violences par le développement d’une activité génératrice de revenu et rentable.

L’activité consiste à acheter des poussins, les élevés et les vendre dans le marché, les restaurants ou à des particuliers. Cela se fera en travail d’équipe. Un membre se lancera à la recherche de ma clientèle et les deux autre s’occuperont du poulailler proprement dit. Pour suivre de très prés l’évolution des poussins, une réunion se tiendra chaque semaine. Une autre réunion pour dégager le montant du remboursement de la somme mensuelle se tiendra tout les mois. Le compte de l’Association sera alimenté par les bénéfices tirés de l’activité."

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.name: Sophie Bernadette

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by three women from the village of Diourou, represented by Sophie Bernadette C.. The group describes their business plan as follows:

“This project aims to commercialize the products of African artisans, offering its clients various opportunities to market hand-dyed Bazin (a traditional African cloth), better known as thioub. For this purpose, the group will purchase a supply of both rich Bazin and second-quality Bazin, to match the preference and purchasing power of our clientele.

The clothing market is thriving in spite of the poor economic situation. The traditional boubou (a long robe or dress typically worn in West Africa) is commonly worn by the Senegalese people – young and old, men and women – especially during family celebrations such as marriages and baptisms, on Fridays (when Muslims gather at the mosque for prayer), during Ramadan (a holy month of fasting for Muslims), for the festivals of Korité (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Fitr, this holiday celebrates the breaking of the fast at the end of Ramadan), Tabaski (known outside Senegal as Eid al-Kabir, this celebration marks a high point during the season of pilgrimage to Mecca), etc.

There is strong demand in this sector. In order to be competitive, we plan to set our prices reasonably in relation to our various market targets. We will take full advantage of our address book, which will surely play an important role [in establishing a good clientele base]. This market generally requires a fairly large initial investment, and the profit margins are quite good.

This project aims to meet the clothing needs of our target clientele – children, adolescents, and adults. Its goal is to create employment, and it will allow us to contribute to the economic development of our country, because our long-term objective is to form an official SME (Small/Medium Enterprise, a status which entitles holders to various state-sponsored business promotion services in Senegal), to hire paid staff and therefore create employment, and to import from and export to other African countries such as the Ivory Coast with Wax (a traditional African cloth) skirts, Gabon with Gabonese robes, Morocco with jallabé and other leather or artificial leather accessories – and why not? – with the countries of Asia as well.

Original French:

"Le projet est destiné à commercialiser les produits des produits africains (art…). Ce projet propose à ses clients plusieurs services dans le domaine de la commercialisation du Bazin teinté plus connu sous le nom de thioub. Pour cela, la promotrice s’approvisionnera en Bazin riche et en Bazin de seconde qualité selon le choix et le pouvoir d’achat de sa clientèle.

Le secteur de l’habillement est un marché porteur malgré la conjoncture. Pour ce qui est du boubou traditionnel il y a une tendance pour les sénégalais (petits et grands, hommes ou femmes ) à s’habiller dans ces tenues surtout lors des cérémonies familiales (mariages, baptêmes etc.) et aussi les vendredi, en période de ramadan, lors des fêtes de korité, Tabaski etc.

Il y a une demande forte par rapport à ce secteur. Pour être compétitif par rapport à nos concurrents, nous comptons pratiquer des prix raisonnables pour nos différentes cibles. Nous mettrons à profit notre carnet d’adresse qui jouera sûrement un très grand rôle. Ce marché a besoin d’un préfinancement souvent assez lourd où les marges bénéficiaires sont assez bonnes

Ce projet cherche à résoudre les besoins de nos cibles jeunes, moins jeunes et adultes en habillement. Il a pour autre objectif la création d’emploi et nous permettra de participer au développement économique de notre pays car nous avons comme objectif à long terme de nous constituer en PME, de recruter du personnel (donc la création d’emploi) et de faire de l’import/export vers des pays africains comme la côte d’Ivoire avec le pagne Wax, le Gabon avec les robes gabonaises le Maroc avec les jallabé et autres accessoires en cuir ou en simili cuir et pourquoi pas vers les pays asiatiques."

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.
