loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Don Gustavo sells fruit and other items in the large outdoor markets of Guayaquil. He owns a small parcel of land in his hometown, Rocafuerte Manabi. He pays two of is nephews to maintain the land and grow a small variety fruits. Once a week Don Gustavo travels to his hometown with his two sons in order to pick up the fruit from his farm and buy more from other farms. His wife also sells fruits from their home in Guayaquil. Don Gustavo will use this loan to be able to buy larger amounts of fruits when he travels to Manabi. He also hopes to invest in new products such as cheese and meats.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fruits and other products to sell in his market

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi L. runs a very small market out of her home. She sells a variety of items including fruits and hygienic products. She started doing business about three years ago thanks to her husband who contributed $200 in start up capital. He realized that the family badly needed another source of income but he was concerned about his wife working and not being able to care for their 4 small children. The store has been a great solution as Mayi has a stable flow of revenue without having to leave the children alone. Every month her husband tries to give her about $20 in order to invest in the store. Mayi is seeking this loan in order to buy in bulk from wholesalers and to start investing in the physical appearance of the market.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase and diversify the inventory in her market

loans.name: Víctor

texts.en:
Victor is a vendor at local markets and fairs in Guayaquil. He sells a variety of items including cell phone accessories, baseball caps, sunglasses and others. He begins selling at 6 every morning and works until the sunset. He first started doing this type of business when he was ten with his father. He got married when he was 17 and now has a 3 year old daughter. He still lives in his parents home in an apartment they made for him. His goal is to increase his sales in order to one day have a home of his own for his young family. He plans to use the money from this loan in order to invest in new products for the Christmas season.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cell phones, baseball caps, sunglasses and other products to sell

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Sofia works as a jewelry and clothes vendor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She started off a seamstress who worked from home. She was able to save about $100 and invest in jewelry as a new activity. Her husband also helped her accrue these savings with the profit from his aluminum and glass workshop that is also run out of their home. This couple works closely together in order to support each others businesses because these microenterprises are the main source of income in their household of 3 children. Although they have always financed their businesses through their own savings they have come to realize that they need loans in order to increase revenue and profits. They will use these loans in order to invest fabric, clothes and jewelry for Sofia and in glass for the workshop.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in fabrics, clothes and other materials

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a street vendor in Guayaquil, Ecuador. He uses a tricycle with a large platform in order to travel around his community selling a variety of items. He generates a good amount of business because his items are very accessible to the people in his neighborhood. His wife helps him by buying the products and sometimes traveling along with him in his daily route. He is seeking a loan in order to purchase his products at wholesale prices and possibly invest in a second tricycle for his wife to use. He works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon trying to cover as much ground as he can. He and his wife have two children together and they hope that with the profits generated from their investments they can improve their wooden house by starting to build cement sections.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy products at wholesale prices and invest in a new cart

loans.name: Ablavi Séli

texts.en:
Single and mother of 2 children from different fathers, Miss A. is an unmarried mother who is very dynamic, but who has not had the chance to find a good husband. For a very long time, her older brother took care of her in Lomé and her children were living far away from her: one with her grandmother in the village and the second one was with her in-laws in very poor conditions.

Worried about taking care of herself and providing education for her children, Miss A. has started working as a house girl in order to get the working capital she needs to start small income generating activities.

Such a second hand Clothings trade allows her to do the following:

* Create her own job and to improve progressively her socio-economic living conditions

* Decrease the alienation she feels with her senior brother through her self sufficiency

* Contribute to her children\'s education and well-being.

The project exists to strengthen the second hand clothing trade which could be very profitable to Miss Seli Ablavi A. if she is successful buying the bales as a whole, instead of in retail. Buying the bales in retail requires having more consistent funds, and she does not have this luxury.

Furthermore, she forecasts expanding her activities to the cereals trade by buying and storing the agriculture products in abundance and reselling them for a profit. The project perfect implemention will allow her to improve her business\' profitability and grow her income enough to take care of her children\'s educational needs.

The credit of $800 will serve to rent a small shop and will allow her to have at her disposal suitable goodwill to strengthen her businesses. Currently, such a project deserves to be supported with the goal to help blossom businesses run by women in difficult economic situations. Français

Célibataire et mère de 2 enfants de différents pères, Mlle A. Abla Féli est une fille mère très dynamique mais n’a pas eu la chance de tomber sur un bon mari pour créer un foyer. Elle est restée très longtemps à la charge de son grand frère à Lomé et les enfants sont éparpillés chez les proches parents dans des conditions pitoyables. Soucieuse de se prendre en charge et de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants, Mlle A. a exercé le job de domestique pour se faire un capital pour débuter une petite activité génératrice de revenus. Ce commerce exercé lui a permis, entre autres de : se créer un emploi et d’améliorer progressivement ses conditions de vie socio-économique - Réduire sa dépendance vis-à-vis de son grand frère par son auto prise en charge - Contribuer à la scolarisation et au mieux-être de ses enfants ; Le projet consiste à renforcer le commerce de friperies qui pouvait être très rentable à Mlle A. Ablavi Séli si elle arrivait à acheter elle-même en gros les balles au lieu du détail, ce qui nécessite des moyens financiers plus consistants qu’elle ne dispose pas actuellement. Par ailleurs, elle prévoit étendre ses activités au commerce de céréales en achetant et stockant les produits agricoles en période d’abondance pour les revendre en période de soudure. La parfaite réalisation de projet lui permettra d’améliorer la rentabilité de ses affaires et d’accroître ses revenus en vue de prendre entièrement en charge l’éducation de ses enfants et subvenir à ses besoins.

Le crédit de $ 800 sollicité servira à louer un petit magasin et lui permettra de disposer d’un fonds de commerce adéquat pour renforcer ses affaires. Aujourd’hui, un tel projet mérite d’être soutenu en vue de l’épanouissement de cette jeune femme en situation économique difficile.

loans.use: Warehouse renting and  Second hand clothing bales purchasing

loans.name: Yawa Enyonam

texts.en:
Mme. Yawa Enyonam T., 41 years old, is a mother of 04 children. Abandoned by her husband, her current income does not cover her needs and that of her children who are all at her charge. Very enterprising and experienced in nutrition, she has undertook soy processing activities which provide for her a substantial income allowing her partly cover her household expenses. This project consists in strengthening her soy beans by-product processing and marketing activities, namely: soy milk, soy yogurt soy cakes and doughnuts, soy flour for porridge or for the soup made with the Moringa leaves very rich in proteins and vitamins and well appreciated by patients living with HIV/AIDS to strengthen their nutritional immunity. The production is surrounded with an exceptional hygiene and quality of the product is well appreciated by the consumers. The proof is in the increasing demand registered that the currently production does not succeed to cover. The market is growing and is far from saturated. The credit requested will serve to acquire the small material and production equipment (vegetable mill, Cooker, Stove…). It will also give her the working capital necessary to have a safety stock in order to assure the production of best quality all over the year.

Français Agée de 41 ans Mme T. Yawa Enyonam est mère de 04 enfants. Abandonnée par son mari, ses revenus actuels n’arrivent pas à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Très entreprenante et expérimentée en nutrition, elle a entrepris cette activité de transformation de soja qui lui procure un revenu substantiel lui permettant d’assurer en partie les charges de son ménage. Le projet consiste à renforcer ses activités de transformation et de commercialisation des produits dérivés du soja, notamment : le lait de soja - le yaourt de soja - le gâteau et beignet de soja - la farine de soja pour la bouillie ou pour la sauce associée avec les feuilles du Moringa très riche en protéines et en vitamines et bien apprécié par les personnes vinant avec le VIH/SIDA pour renforcer leur immunité nutritionnelle. Le crédit de $ 800 sollicité va servir à acquérir le petit matériel et outillage de production (Moulinette, cuisinière, fourneau, etc.), à disposer d’un fonds de roulement nécessaire pour avoir un stock de sécurité afin de garantir la production de meilleure qualité sur toute l’année.

loans.use: Soya beans by-products processing and marketing (Agribusiness)

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Madam Yawa A. is an illiterate woman, about 39 years old. She is the mother of five (05) children and one among the several women of a husband virtually absent. She lives in the remote and enclosed village of Wougome-Dogbede-Kope without electricity and where the sole source of light is the kerosene lamp or oil lamp. To have a small quantity of kerosene, the inhabitants are obliged to cover a long distance of 5 to 15 km. Very talented in the identification and businesses opportunities analysis, she has made the choice as main activity the selling of paraffin oil which is increasing enough well. But due her very limited financial means, she is faced with many demands which she is unable to satisfy. Today, she needs the amount of $850 which will serve to buy a tank of 200 litres and to increase her stock of products. This new possibility will help her to satisfy not only the needs of her village, but also those of the five (05) other surrounding villages. This will allow Madame Yawa A. to live from the fruit of her work and to better satisfy her needs such as: foods, health, children dressing and education.

Mme A. YAWA est une femme analphabète âgée de 39 ans environ. Physiquement bien portante, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants et l’une des multiples femmes d’un mari virtuellement absent. Elle vit dans le village reculé et enclavé de Wougome-Dogbedakopé sans électricité et où la seule source de lumière est la lampe à pétrole ou le lampion. Pour avoir un peu de pétrole, les habitants sont obligés de parcourir de une longue distance de 5 à 15 km Très douée dans l’identification et dans l’analyse des opportunités d’affaires, elle s’est choisie pour activité principale la vente du pétrole lampant qui lui réussit assez bien. Cependant, par ses moyens financiers très limités, elle est confrontée à beaucoup de demandes qu’elle est incapable de satisfaire. Elle a besoin aujourd’hui de $ 850 qui serviront à installer une cuve de 2000 litres et disposer d’un stock marchand conséquent en vue d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Cette nouvelle possibilité lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement les besoins de son village mais aussi ceux de cinq (05) autres villages environnants. Ceci permettra à Mme Yawa A. de vivre du fruit de son travail et de mieux subvenir à ses besoins immédiats, notamment: l’alimentation, la santé, l’habillement et l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: Tank acquisition and kerosene purchase

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.en:
About 45 years old, Madam Ablavi A. is a mother of four (04) children, and has at her charge two (02) motherless orphans. Tireless and very talented, she has the sense of a good educator and she is fighting for the success of her children. She is makes a living through the processing of palm oil into red oil, which is well appreciated and widely consumed in Togo. Her seasonal activity is flourishing due to the usefulness of the by-products of palm oil which provide her other sources of income. The activities of Madame Ablavi A. require a financing of $550 to buy palm nuts and tanks to make an significant stock to be sold in the case of shortage. That opportunity will allow her to increase her production and thus her income to ensure the essential needs of the numerous children for whom she is responsible.

Agée de 45 ans environ, Mme Ablavi A. est mère de quatre (04) enfants et a sa charge deux (02) enfants orphelins de mère. Infatigable et très dévouée, elle a le sens d’une bonne éducatrice et se bat pour la réussite de ses enfants. Elle vit à Klémé Sanguéra où elle exerce l’activité la transformation de la noix de palme en huile rouge très appréciée et consommée au Togo. Cette activité saisonnière est très florissante à cause de tous les dérivés de la noix de palme qui constituent également d’autres sources de revenus. Les activités Mme Ablavi A. nécessitent aujourd’hui un financement de $ 550 pour l’achat des noix de palme et de tonneaux pour faire un stock important à être revendu en période de soudure. Cette opportunité lui permettra d’accroître sa production et de facto augmenter ses revenus pour assurer les besoins élémentaires de ses nombreux enfants qui sont presque tous abandonnés à elle seule.

loans.use: Palm nuts purchasing for palm oil fabrication and trading

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Madam Massan D., spouse of ATCHON was born in 1954 at Ekpui, in the prefecture of Vo. She made her studies in Ghana and has always kept the Anglophone style. Married and mother of 4 children, she is a very devoted and dynamic woman in commercial activities and operates a food shop situated in Lomé, the area of N’tifafa-Komé. She has always shown the proof of good management and her previous credits have been promptly repaid and without incident. Her selling of food is coupled with the selling of the Brassiere beverages in retail. In order to increase the profitability of her activities, she needs a financing of $550 in order to be able to respond to the increasing demand of her customers. This credit will serve to constitute a stock of foodstuffs and beverage products in view of the end years activities, and especially the Christmas and New Year feasts

Madame D. Massan épouse ATCHON est née en 1954 à Ekpui dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle a fait ses études au Ghana et a toujours gardé le style anglophone. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle est une femme très dévouée et dynamique dans les activités commerciales et tient une boutique d’alimentation générale sise à Lomé quartier N’tifafa-Komé à Lomé. Elle est une femme qui se respecte et se fait respecter par son entourage. Elle a fait preuve de bonne gestionnaire à travers ses crédits antérieurs promptement remboursés et sans incident. Ce commerce d’alimentation générale est couplé avec la vente de détail des boissons de la brasserie. Le développement et la meilleure rentabilité de ces activités nécessitent un financement de $550 pour pouvoir répondre à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Ce crédit servira à constituer un stock de produits alimentaires et de boissons en vue des activités de fin d’année, et surtout des fêtes de Noël et de Nouvel An.

loans.use: To buy and storage foodstuffs and beverages products

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Madam Akossiwa A. was born in 1955 in Tsévié in the Prefecture of Zio. She is the mother of five (05) children. Very dynamic and hardworking, she undertook early the trade of wood charcoal and cereals, two activities which are flourishing very well currently. The charcoal is bought by households for cooking, and cereals constitute the main basic food in Togo. She has shown many times her good management ability and demonstrated hard work. Considering the success implemented in her activities and significant increased demand, she needs greater financial means in order to respond to the market. The offer of this $450 credit will allow her to rent a store and assure a permanent stock for her activities and profitability.

Mme A. Akossiwa est née en 1955 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio. Elle est mère de cinq enfants. Très dynamique et audacieuse, elle a très tôt entrepris le commerce du charbon de bois et des céréales, deux activités qui lui fleurissent aujourd’hui très bien ; le charbon étant très sollicité dans les ménages pour le chauffage et les céréales constituant l’essentiel de l’alimentation de base au Togo. Elle a démontré à plusieurs reprises sa capacité de bonne gestionnaire et sa rigueur au travail. Vu le succès qu’elle réalise dans ses activités et les demandes de plus en plus importantes, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers afin de pouvoir répondre aux exigences du marché. L’octroi de ce crédit des $ 450 lui permettra de louer un emplacement et d’assurer un stock permanent pour la pérennité et une rentabilité de ses activités.

loans.use: To rent a location and make important storage of charcoal

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
This loan will be shared by five members of the Yonn Njal Association, represented by Mathias D.. The group hails from Palmarin, a tiny fishing village on the edge of the immense salt flats of the Saloum River delta in central Senegal. Palmarin’s location favors the production of gejj, the salty dried fish that is a staple of traditional Senegalese cooking and is in high demand by housewives throughout the country. The loan will be used to purchase fresh fish from the fishermen of the village, salt and dry the fish on racks in the sun, and transport the finished gejj to markets in distant towns and cities.

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Dried fish production

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica owns a small store where she sells a wide variety of items including: snacks, jewelry, appliances and office supplies. She started her business off with only $5 in capital when she only sold tortillas and coffee. Slowly she began to grow and with the help of her mother she was able to open her small store where she sold rice, sugar, chicken, eggs and other foods. Now she sells many different products that are not food and she still prepares tortillas and coffee on the weekends. Veronica is a single mother who lives with her parents who have supported her since she separated from her husband. She hopes to invest in new and diverse products with the loan she receives from Kiva and Mifex. She is also contemplating opening up a second operation selling clothing.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Diversify and increase product offerings

loans.name: Belgica

texts.en:
Bélgica is a single mother with 3 children. She supports her family with the income she makes from selling chickens and water. She began to work in poultry sale with her ex-husband. They owned a business together where she was in charge in preparing the chickens for her husband to sell. 3 years ago they got divorced and Bélgica was forced to open her own business with $100 she had saved up. She bought a cart to sell chicken from and now she has also begun to sell water. Because she could not make it on her own she was forced to move in with her mother who helps her by taking care of the children. She has observed that there is plenty of demand in her community and needs the loan in order to buy more poultry and water for her clients. She hopes that with the profits she can move out on her own with her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy chicken and drinking water to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Don Miguel has been making sandals since he was a young boy. He learned his craft from his father and has since passed his knowledge of the sandal trade to his wife, whom he works with every day. Mr. B.’s entire family helps out with the business one way or another, and each individual plays a crucial part in keeping the shop going. Miguel is applying for this loan so that he can purchase raw materials for his sandals, such as leather soles, straps, laminant, and glues. In order to prepare himself for the Christmas holiday, when more buying happens than at any other point during the year, Miguel would like to take out this loan through Kiva and Mifex. The sandal business has been good to Mr. B.. He says that although he is not rich, he is proud that he owns his home and has two boys who study hard in school. One of Miguel’s dreams is to open a storefront in one of the fairs or markets in Guayaquil, but in order to do that, he says, he will need capital to jumpstart his business.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy materials for sandal making

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Don Ricardo owns a repair shop where he fixes electronics. He specializes in audio and visual equipment but also works on computers and household appliances. He has been working in this type of activity for over 25 years since he was an assistant in his grandfather’s shop. Don Ricardo has 3 children who are fully grown, but he and his wife insist on surviving by their own means and working in this shop. One of his sons and a nephew also help him with repairs and by bringing in clients. Don Ricardo will use the loan in order to buy replacement pieces and electrical materials at wholesale prices. This will help his business by reducing costs and increasing productivity as he will have a stock of replacements at his shop and will no longer have to go out and buy these items every time he needs them for higher prices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in repair pieces for his workshop

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.en:
Mr. V. was born on October 13, 1973 in Lomé, in the prefecture of Golf. Having not been able to continue his studies, he has been trained in high fashion design, for which he has demonstrated success. Married without children for the moment, he is living with three (03) dependents. He is the design master with 27 apprentices of whom 23 are young girls. Very social, calm and cool, he is a likable man and appreciated in his suburb and in the area. Also generous and charitable, he is training some girls in his workshop for free, and helps out with some of his apprentices\\\\\\\' needs like health care and lunch in the centre. His workshop is well attended and his machines are sufficient to respond to the current demand, considering the very high number of the apprentices. He plans now to acquire additional sewing machines and to undertake haberdashery trade near his workshop. This expansion of his activities requires a credit of $850, allowing him to acquire the two sewing machines and haberdashery articles.

M. V. est né le 13 octobre 1973 à Lomé, dans la préfecture du golfe. N’ayant pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études, il s’est fait former en haute coouture qu’il exerce impeccablement aujourd’hui. Marié sans enfant pour le moment, il a pourtant à trois personnes à sa charge. Il est maître tailleur avec 27 d’apprentis dont 23 jeunes filles. Très sociable et plus féministe, son air très calme et sa patience font de lui, un homme très aimé et apprécié dans son entourage et dans le quartier. Aussi généreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certaines filles très nécessiteuses et subvient à certains besoins de ses apprenties comme la santé et la déjeuner au centre. Son atelier est très bien fréquenté et ses machines sont insuffisantes pour répondre aux exigences du moment vu le nombre très élevé d’apprentis. Il prévoit alors d’acquérir des machines à coudre complémentaires et d’entreprendre le commerce de mercerie (vente de tissus et des articles de couture) à côté de son atelier. Cette extension de ses activités nécessite des moyens financiers de $ 850 lui permettant d’acquérir les deux machines à coudre et les articles de la mercerie

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and haberdashery articles

loans.name: Madam Adjovi Séraphi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi Séraphine S. was born in 1976 at Kouvé. Married and mother of five (05) children, she is a hair dresser by trade and has opened her own hair dressing workshop “COIFFURE REVELATION” in Lomé. Her good work made her reputation in the area. Moreover, Madam S. has well understood that, in Lomé, the best equipped hair salons are more attended by the customers. So, to attract more customers, she plans to enlarge and equip her hair dressing salon with modern and higher performance materials. Very enterprising, she also wants to sell quality beauty products at her salon. This will provide her additional income to contribute to the needs of her household. The credit of $650 will serve to buy two (02) hair driers and to increase her stock of beauty products and cloths. This ambitious project deserves to be supported.

Mme Adjovi Séraphine S. est née en 1976 à Kouvé. Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, elle est coiffeuse de formation et a ouvert son atelier de coiffure « COIFFURE REVELATION »à Lomé. Son travail bien fait, fait sa réputation dans le quartier. Toutefois, Mme S. l’a si bien compris qu’à Lomé, les salons de coiffure les mieux équipées sont plus fréquentés par les clients. Aussi, œuvre-t-elle en ce sens. Ainsi, pour séduire et attirer davantage sa clientèle, elle prévoit agrandir et mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par de matériels modernes et plus performants. Très entreprenante, elle joint aujourd’hui à son métier de coiffure, le commerce de produits de beauté. Ce qui lui procurera des revenus complémentaires pour contribuer aux besoins de son foyer. Le crédit de $ 650sollicité servira à acheter deux séchoirs et à faire un stock de produits de beauté et de tissus. Cet ambitieux projet mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To buy two hair driers  and storage beauty products and clothes

loans.name: Madam  Sélom Kafui

texts.en:
Madam Kafui Sélom G. operates a beverage bar and food store in the area N’kafu. A young, dynamic woman of 29 years old, she is married and is a mother of a child and had four (04) dependents. A hair dresser by trade, she had to abandon this career which was not profitable.She launched her retail business in 2004 with the opening of her own shop. She started her commercial activities with her own financial means of $180 and is entirely dedicated to her trade. She had benefited twice from a credit of $550 and promptly repaid and without incident.

Her commercial activity lies mainly in selling beverages and staple grocery products (sugar, soap, milk, tomatoes…). Today, this trade is coupled with the opening of a restaurant which has been growing marvelously for about more than five (05) months. This secondary activity, which she only runs during the weekend for the moment, is well-liked because the menus and meals presented to the customers. Today, considering the significance that her activities are taking on, Madam G. is requesting a credit of $ 750 to increase her trade and to respond to her customers needs.

Madame G. Sélom Kafui est détentrice d’un débit de boisson et d’une boutique d’alimentation générale et de divers au Quartier N’kafu. Jeune femme très dynamique âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant et a en charge quatre (04) autres personnes. Coiffeuse de profession, elle à dû abandonner ce métier qui ne lui était pas très rentable pour se lancer dans le commerce depuis 2004 avec l’ouverture de sa propre boutique. Elle a commencé ses activités commerciales avec ses propres moyens financiers de $180 et s’est sacrifiée totalement à son commerce. Elle avait bénéficié deux fois de suite d’un crédit de $ 550 promptement remboursé et sans incident. Son activité commerciale repose essentiellement sur la vente des boissons de la Brasserie et des produits alimentaires de première nécessité (sucre, savon, lait, tomate…). Ce commerce est couplé aujourd’hui avec l’ouverture d’un restaurant qui marche à merveille depuis plus de cinq (05) mois. Cette activité secondaire qui se fait uniquement les week end pour le moment, marche très bien compte tenu des plats et des mets proposés et très appréciés par les clients. Aujourd’hui, compte tenu de l’importance que prennent ses activités commerciales, Mme G. de sollicite un crédit de $ 850 pour agrandir son commerce et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap, milk tomatoes…  and beverages

loans.name: Madam Ayélé Catherin

texts.en:
Madam Catherine Ayélé D., spouse of ADJO, is living in the area of N’kafu (Toyota Bar) in Lomé. This woman of 30 years old is a mother of three (03) children among whom two are twins (girls). Beside her own children, she takes care of an orphan dependent. Her husband is an unemployed printer and all the household duties are left up to her. She has started her business selling basic groceries, (sugar, condensed tomato, fresh tomato, soap, detergents and others…) over the past two years with only the limited means she had at her disposal. Her business did not move forward significantly at the beginning on account of the insufficiency of the working capitals, is today enough flourishing due to the devotion and determination of Madam D., who deserves to be supported financially. The demand growing due to the very commercial location of the business, but her supply is insufficient.

Madam D. requests currently $ 500 to build up a significant stock of merchandise in order to respond to the customers demands. To finance this woman is to save a whole family.

Madame D. Ayélé Catherine épouse ADJO est domiciliée au quartier N’kafu (Toyota Bar) à Lomé. Cette femme âgée de 30 ans, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants dont des jumelles. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a en charge un autre enfant de parents très démunis. Son mari est un imprimeur régulièrement en chômage et presque tous les besoins de foyer repose très souvent sur elle. Elle a commencé ses activités de vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité (sucre, tomate en boîte, tomate fraîche, savon, détergents et autres…) il y a deux (02) ans avec les moyens dérisoires qu’elle disposait. Cette activité qui n’avait pas connu une évolution significative au départ pour insuffisance de fonds de commerce, est aujourd’hui assez florissante à cause du dévouement et de la détermination de Madame D. qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement aujourd’hui. La demande se fait de plus en plus pressante à cause de l’emplacement très commercial de l’activité mais l’offre est insuffisante. Madame D. sollicite aujourd’hui $ 500 pour constituer un stock important de marchandises à être revendu en période de soudure afin de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver toute une famille.

loans.use: To supply merchandises (sugar, soap, milk, sweets, chocolate, etc.)

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.en:
Mr. Kouassi H. was born in Lomé on August 16, 1952. He is married and father of four (04) children but has five (05) dependents. Accountant by trade but unemployed, he started his private business by selling fresh water and ice blocks. Currently, he has at his disposal two centres of water processing at Attikpodji not far from the big market and the second at Kégué, a suburb of Lomé. In Togo, ice blocks are in very high demand especially during the dry seasons due to the warmth. Owing to that activity, Mr. H. has at his disposal a substantial income which allows him today to nourish his family.

The credit of $500 which he is requesting currently should serve to buy one freezer and two coolers and to set up another retail location for the coming dry season when the demand is greatest.

H. Kouassi est né à Lomé le 16 août 1952. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants mais prend en charge cinq autres personnes. Comptable de formation sans emploi, il s’est vite lancé dans l’initiative privée par la vente d’eau et de moule de glace. Il dispose actuellement de deux centres de transformation à Attikpodji non loin du grand marché et le second à Kégué, banlieue de Lomé. Au Togo, les moules de glace sont très recherchées surtout pendant les saisons sèches à cause de la chaleur. Grâce à cette activité, M. H. dispose d’un revenu substantiel qui lui permet aujourd’hui de nourrir sa famille. Le crédit de $ 500 qu’il sollicite aujourd’hui devra servir à acheter un réfrigérateur, et deux glacières pour agrandir ses activités et à installer un autre centre à l’approche de cette saison sèche qui s’annonce où la demande est plus forte.

loans.use: To buy one freezer and 2 coolers

loans.name: Hélène

texts.en:
Miss Helene K. is a young, dynamic woman and mother of a girl whose father has been missing for three years. Abandoned and on her own, she has many difficulties to overcome and much to finance: food, rent, her child\'s education, clothing, etc. Born in 1974, she successfully completed her secondary education. She had her first professional experience in a private school. As a misfortune never happens alone, she had to put an end to that activity of teaching as her already low salary was not even paid to her. Very bewildered but keeping her courage, as she has nobody to help her, she has undertook the trade of sweets, biscuits and chocolates with $35 which she had at her disposal. After that she received a credit of $100 she repaid. Her second credit of $200 allowed her to expand her activities to shoes and beauty products, which could bring her more income if she has possessed a more consistent working fund. Currently, at the coming of the year end feasts, she needs $550 to buy articles, namely: womens shoes and beauty products. This will help her to grow her income and to improve her own living condition and that of her children.

Mlle Hélène K. est une jeune femme très dynamique et mère d’une fille dont le Père est introuvable depuis trois ans. Abandonnée à elle-même, elle a du mal à joindre les deux bouts : nourritures, loyer, scolarité de son enfant, habillement, etc. Née en 1974, elle est une femme lettrée qui a terminée le second cycle de l’enseignement général. Elle a eu ses premières expériences professionnelles dans une école privée. Comme un malheur n’arrive jamais seul, elle a dû mettre fin à cette activité d’enseignante qui tourne à la mésaventure car le maigre salaire aussi ne se payait pas. Très désemparée mais gardant son courage car n’ayant personne à lui venir en aide, elle a entrepris le commerce de bonbons , biscuits a chocolats avec $ 35 qu’elle disposait. Par la suite elle a obtenu un crédit de $ 100 qu’elle avait bien remboursé. Son second crédit de $ 200 lui a permis d’étendre ses activités à la vente de chaussures et produits de beauté qui pouvait lui rapporter si elle possédait un fonds de roulement plus consistant. Aujourd’hui, à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année, elle a besoin de $ 550 pour acheter les articles, notamment des chaussures de femmes et des produits de beauté en vue d’accroître ses revenus et d’améliorer ses propres conditions de vie et celles de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy women shoes and beauty products,

loans.name: Dieudonné Mawuéna

texts.en:
Mr. Dieudonné Mawuéna A. is a carpenter by trade and works in his own workshop in Lomé. Born on 15th March 1965 at Kovié, he is married and a father of seven (07) children from three different mothers. After middle school, he had to abandon his studies to be trained in carpentry. Due to a lack of financial and material means, he was faced with very difficult situation after his training. Very enterprising, the creative spirit that he possesses allows him to attract and win continually the trust of his customers. Through his good work he continues to gain customers and this makes his reputation excellent in his area. With the success of experience with the first two credits of $300 and $550 which were repaid without problem, he plans to expand his business to wood selling in order to increase his profit margins and to take care of his numerous family members. They will be sold to other carpenters who travel most of the time long distances to get woods. This will be more profitable to his businesses and will increase his income allowing him to improve his family living conditions. The credit of $ 850 he requests will serve to buy the small working tools, wood supplying and transportation from the inner country to Lomé.

Monsieur Dieudonné Mawuéna A. est menuisier de formation et travaille dans son propre atelier à Lomé. Né le 15 mars 1965 à Kovié, il est marié et père de sept enfants de trois femmes différentes. Après son second cycle de l’enseignement, il a du abandonner ses études pour se former en menuiserie. Il a connu un début très difficile après sa formation dû au manque de moyens matériels et financiers. Très dynamique et entreprenant, il possède un esprit de créativité qui lui permet de séduire et de gagner continuellement la confiance de sa clientèle. A travers son travail bien fait, sa clientèle ne fait que s’accroître, ce qui fait sa réputation dans son quartier. Avec ses expériences réussies de ses deux premiers crédits de $ 300 et $ 550 remboursés sans problème, il prévoit étendre ses activités à la vente de bois en vue d’augmenter ses marges bénéficiaires et s’occuper de sa nombreuse famille. Il va en vendre à d’autres menuisiers qui parcourent souvent de longues distances pour en trouver. Ce qui rentabilisera davantage ces affaires et augmentera ses revenus lui permettant d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le crédit de $ 850 sollicité servira de fonds de commerce pour l’acquisition de petit outillage, l’approvisionnement et le transport du bois depuis l’intérieur du pays jusqu’à Lomé

loans.use: Small working tools, woods supplying and transportation

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Madam Antoinette F. has had for two (2) years a small trade of cold water, ice, and fruit juice production in Lomé. This activity has taken an important place due to the high demand which exists in the area and especially during the dry seasons where the warmth is excessive and where members of the population are consuming to refresh themselves. Born on January 17th, 1967 and mother of three (3) children, Madam Antoinette is an accountant by trade. Unfortunately, she didn’t have the luck of a stable job. Therefore, she decided to launch in this trade which provides an income that allows her to cover her needs. Considering the importance that constitutes this activity characterised by increasingly higher demand, Madam Antoinette forecasts to expand her project by selling other products like frozen fish. The proximity of her trade near the market of N’kafu proves a great advantage. The credit of $650 that she is soliciting today will serve to buy one freezer, two coolers, supplies of fresh fish and chicken, and fruit juice fabrication products.

Madame Antoinette F. tient depuis deux ans à Lomé un petit commerce de production et de commercialisation de la glace, d’eau fraîche et de jus de fuit. Cette activité a pris une ampleur importante à cause de la forte demande qui existe dans le quartier particulièrement pendant les saisons sèches où la chaleur est excessive et où les populations en consomment assez pour se rafraîchir. Née le 17 janvier 1967 et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame Antoinette est comptable de formation, mais elle n’a pas eu la chance d’avoir un emploi stable. Aussi, a-t-elle décidé de se lancer dans ce commerce qui lui procure un revenu qui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Compte tenu de l’engouement que suscite cette activité caractérisée par une demande de plus en plus forte, Antoinette prévoit étendre son projet par la vente d’autres produits comme les poissons congelés. La proximité de son commerce à côté du marché de N’kafu lui est un très grand avantage pour l’écoulement rapide de ses produits. Le crédit de $ 850 qu’elle sollicite aujourd’hui va servir acquérir un congélateur, deux glacières et s’approvisionner régulièrement en poisson, en poulet et en produits de fabrication du jus de fruit.

loans.use: To buy one freezer and two coolers

loans.name: Cécile

texts.en:
Madam Cécile A. is 35 years old, married, and a mother of two (2) children. Her husband is a house-to-house photographer who does not have a stable income. As a result most of the household expenses rest on her such as rent, food, childrens clothing, etc. Madam A. has been fabricating and selling “LOUGA” for eight (8) years. It is a biscuit made from groundnut and sugar and is popular during feasts and large gatherings. The beginnings of this activity have been not easy for Madam A. due to her very limited means. She had started her activities with $50. With her faith in what she is doing and by her courage, she has succeeded to increase her capital to $300 thanks to three consecutives credits which have been repaid well. She also associated to this trade of “LOUGA” the selling of grilled and bottled groundnut. Considering the quality of these products, she was made by the women the supplying in whole and to resell in detail. Today, the demand is so high that some put in orders at least one week in advance but are not fulfilled. Madam A. is not able to satisfy all of her customers due to a lack means. She is requesting a credit of $500 for storage of raw materials to promote the growth of her production and then automatically to increase her income. The credit will be used for buying sugar and groundnut for the entire year\'s production.

Madame A. Cécile est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari est un photographe ambulant et donc ne dispose pas d’un revenu fixe si bien que la plupart des charges du foyer repose bien sur elle : loyer, nourriture, habillement des enfants, etc. Il y a huit (08) ans que Madame A. fabrique et vend du louga. C’est un biscuit obtenu à partir de l’arachide et du sucre et bien apprécié par la population pendant les fêtes et les grandes manifestations. Les débuts de cette activité n’ont pas été faciles pour Madame A. à cause des moyens très limités. Elle avait commencé ses activités avec $ 50. Avec sa foi en ce qu’elle fait et par son courage, elle a réussi à augmenter son capital à $ 300 grâce à trois crédits successifs qui avaient été bien remboursés. Elle associe aussi à ce commerce du louga, la vente de l’arachide grillée embouteillée. Compte tenu de la qualité de ses produits, des bonnes femmes viennent s’en procurer en gros chez elle pour les revendre. Aujourd’hui, la demande est si forte que certains clients passent des commandes au moins une semaine d’avance, mais n’en trouvent pas. Madame A. n’est pas en mesure de satisfaire toute sa clientèle à cause de l’insuffisance de ses moyens. Aussi, sollicite-t-elle un crédit $ 500 pour accroître la taille de sa production et d’augmenter ses revenus. Le crédit servira à constituer un stock permanent d’arachide et de sucre favorisant la production sur toute l’année

loans.use: Fabrication and selling of “LOUGA” (biscuit of groundnut)

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
About 35 years old, she is a widower and mother of three (3) children. Having not the chance to go to school, Madam Massan N. swore that none of her children will remain illiterate like her and is fighting for their education. Very clever and active, she remains one of the working women in the village of Ahonkpé where she lives with her orphans. Her main activity is to purchase cassave and process it into flour (cassava flour), one of the basic foods in south Togo. Madam N. has shown proved to be an honest and trustworthy woman through the repayments without incidents of her first two credits granted. The flour production is a very hard activity with many risks of injury due to a lack of suitable tools. Buying a tool, the rough, with a credit of $750 will provide an important opportunity to increase her production and income. The rough could even be rented to other women in the area. This will provide to them significant income. Having the rough avoids making a 3 to 5 km trek to have the cassava rasped. The remainder of the credit will serve to buy cassava in other farms to have sufficient raw materials for the regular production all over the year.

Agée de 35 ans environ, elle est veuve et mère de trois (03) enfants. N’ayant pas eu la chance de s’instruire, Mme Massan N. a juré qu’aucun de ses enfants ne restera analphabète comme elle et se bat pour leur éducation. Très intelligente et très bien appliquée, elle reste l’une des femmes de référence dans le village de Ahonkpé où elle vit avec ses orphelins. Son activité principale est l’achat de manioc et sa transformation en gari (farine de manioc), l’un des aliments de base au Sud du Togo. Mme Massan N. a fait preuve d’honnêteté et de femme de confiance à travers les remboursements sans incidents de ses deux premiers crédits obtenus. La fabrication du gari est une activité très pénible avec tous les risques de blessures dus au manuel traditionnel de râpage du manioc car ne disposant pas de râpeuse. Le financement d’une râpeuse et d’un fonds de crédit de $ 750 serait un apport très capital pour augmenter sa production et facto ses revenus. La râpeuse pourra même être louée à d’autres femmes de la localité, ce qui lui procurerait d’autres recettes non négligeables. La disposition sur place de la râpeuse évitera de parcourir de longue distance de 3 à 5 km pour aller se faire râper le manioc. Le reste des fonds servira à acheter des champs de manioc afin de disposer suffisamment de matière première pour la production régulière sur toute l’année.

loans.use: To buy rough and cassava farms

loans.name: Dédé

texts.en:
Madam Dédé D. was born in 1962 at Aneho (Togo). Married and mother of a single child, she also supports two (2) dependant children. She started her activities with a small table along the road with about $45 which today has transformed into a foodstuffs shop. Very devoted, dynamic and imaginative, she has began selling cold water and ice for her area as it is cruelly not provided drinking water. Still not satisfied with her activities, she added a phone box to her shop which is a necessity in her area. With all of these projects, Madame Dédé D. has decdied to leave her current trade place which is situated in the big market of Lomé, for her new area in the suburb of Lomé, which will offer more growth opportunities. The credit of $850 she is requesting will serve to enlarge her shop in order to acquire a financial autonomy and cover her family\'s needs. Madame Dédé D.\'s dynamic personality should be encouraged in order to serve as an example for her young sisters.

Mme D. Dédé est née en 1962 à Aného (Togo). Elle est mariée et mère d’un unique enfant mais a deux (02) autres enfants à sa charge. Elle a commencé ses activités avec un petit commerce de table au bord des rues avec soit $ 45, mais, elle détient aujourd’hui une boutique d’alimentation générale. Très dévouée, dynamique imaginative, elle a associé à sa boutique, la vente d’eau et de glaçon car son quartier n’est pas desservi et manque cruellement d’eau potable. Comme ces activités ne lui suffisaient pas, elle a installé une cabine téléphonique qui est une nécessité dans sa zone. Avec tous ses projets, Mme D. Dédé a préféré quitter sa place qui se trouve au grand marché de Lomé pour assainir sa nouvelle zone dans la banlieue de Lomé, ce qui lui fera développer plus ses activités. Le crédit de $ 850 sollicité va servir à agrandir sa boutique afin d’acquérir une autonomie financière et subvenir aux besoins les plus élémentaires de la famille. Le dynamisme de cette femme mérite d’être encouragé afin de servir d’exemple pour ses jeunes sœurs.

loans.use: To buy one freezer and many other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.en:
Madam A. was born in 1956. Married and mother of four (04) children, she is a perseverant and courageous woman. Still very active but having not a lot of means, she is exercising a small trade of beans in order to contribute to the household expenditures. But since the date her husband was retired, the situation has become very difficult in the family. The small old age pension of her husband (which is ofte late) is insignificant for the household needs. So, it belongs to the woman to take in to pay for the nearly total charges of the household. The income benefits from her small trade are not at the level of this responsibility. With a credit of $ 650, Madam A. will increase the size of her activity and get a substantial income in order to respond to the requirements she is facing. The amount solicited will serve to rent a warehouse, to buy, treat, stock and resell beans in higher quantity.

Madame A. est née en 1956. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, elle est une femme persévérante et courageuse. Encore très active mais n’ayant pas beaucoup de moyens, elle fait un petit commerce du haricot pour pouvoir participer aux charges du ménage. Mais depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, la situation est devenue très difficile dans la famille. La petite pension du mari (qui se paie même avec des mois de retard) est insignifiante pour les besoins du ménage. C’est alors qu’il revient à la femme de prendre en charge la quasi-totalité des charges du ménage. Le revenu tiré de son petit commerce n’est pas à la hauteur de cette responsabilité. Avec un crédit de $ 650, Madame A. va augmenter la taille de son activité et dégager un revenu substantiel afin de faire face aux exigences qui se posent à elle désormais. Le montant sollicité servira à louer un magasin, à acheter, à traiter, à stocker et à revendre du haricot en grande quantité.

loans.use: Warehouse renting and beans storage

loans.name: Mawunyo Ekpé

texts.en:
Mr Mawunyo Ekpé B. is a man 43 years old. He is married and father of two (02) children. Jeweller by trade, he is not succeeding to exercise his career due to the lack of means for the very expensive raw materials for the Jewell fabrication. Then, he decided to make a training in aviculture as there were true demand of eggs and consuming chicken on the market of his locality. Being back from his training, he started the chickens breeding with his own limited means at $ 75. He has benefited from three consecutive credits of $ 200; $ 300 and $ 550 which he had well managed and regularly repaid. But still today, his offer is not always at the level of his demand. With his experiences, Mr B. desires highly to expand his activity in order to be able to increase his incomes and improve his family living conditions. To that purpose, he is requesting a credit of $ 850 to enlarge his henhouse and to have at his disposal the fund for the acquisition of provisions.

Monsieur B. Ekpé Mawunyo est un homme âgé de 43 ans. Il s’est marié et est père de deux (02) enfants. Bijoutier de formation, il n’arrive pas a exercer son métier à cause du manque de moyens pour s’installer, les matières premières pour la fabrication des bijoux étant très rares et très chères. Il décida alors de faire une formation en aviculture car il y avait une demande réelle d’œuf et de poulet de chair sur le marché de sa localité. De retour de sa formation, il commença l’élevage des poules avec des moyens ses propres moyens limités à $ 75. Il avait bénéficié de trois crédits successifs de $ 200, $ 300 et $ 550 qu’il avait bien gérés et régulièrement remboursés. Mais à ce jour, l’offre n’est toujours pas à la hauteur de la demande. Avec ses expériences, Monsieur B. désire vivement étendre son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $ 850 pour élargir son poulailler et disposer de fonds pour acquisition les provendes.

loans.use: Henhouse building and provendry purchase

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.en:
Madam Adjovi N. is 38 years old, married and mother of five (05) children with also three (03) dependants of her died brother. Her husband has not any stable economic activity, that is the reason why she is taking in to charge all the family needs. Dress maker by trade, she realized that this career was not so profitable to her as it is only profitable in the feast period. Then, she has decided to make trading. So, she buys paddy rice at Kovié (Togo), husks, stock and resells it on the market of Aného. This activity is very flourishing for her as she is succeeding to make a profit which allows her to provide for her family needs. With all the experience that she has in this trade, she wishes to increase her activities in order to be able to respond to the more and more high demand on the local market. With the credit of $ 850 solicited, she could have at her disposal a consequent working capital to have a permanent stock of rice.

Madame N. Adjovi est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle a également en charge 3 enfants de son frère décédé. Son mari n’a pas d’activité économique fixe, ce qui fait qu’elle prend en charge tous les besoins de la famille. Couturière de formation, elle s’est rendue compte que ce métier ne lui était pas trop rentable car il n’est lucratif qu’en période de fête. Elle a donc décidé de faire du commerce. Ainsi, elle achète du riz paddy à Kovié (Togo), le décortique, le stocke et le revend sur le marché d’Aného. Cette activité est très florissante pour elle car elle arrive à dégager un bénéfice qui lui permette de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Avec toute l’expérience qu’elle a dans ce commerce, elle souhaite augmenter ses activités afin de pouvoir répondre à une demande de plus en plus forte sur le marché local. Avec le crédit des $ 850 sollicités, elle pourra disposer d’un fonds de commerce conséquent pour avoir un stock permanent de riz.

loans.use: Paddy rice storage

loans.name: Massogblé

texts.en:
Waterproofness man by trade, Mr Massogblé T. is married and father of five (05) children. Having not the means to create his own enterprise which necessitates enough high cost and to exercise his career, he was launched in the market of gardening in order to have at his disposal an income resource. Realizing that this activity is profitable, Mr T. has trade in that domain for another specialization. The market gardening production. Particularly, the dry season cultures are very profitable because at that period the products are nearly nonexistent on the markets and those who are doing it, make much benefits. To that purpose, motor pumps are needed, what Mr T. does not have unfortunately. What limits his production and his income could help to save his family from poverty and misery. To increase the size of his production and make much profits, Mr T. needs a credit of $ 700 to acquire a motor pump and fertilizers. He has at his disposal several advantages of lake Togo which crosses his village.

Etanchéiste de profession, Monsieur T. est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. N’ayant pas de moyen pour créer son entreprise qui nécessite un coût assez élevé et exercer son métier, il s’est lancé dans le maraîchage pour pouvoir disposer d’une source de revenu. Voyant que cette activité est rentable, Monsieur T. s’est fait former en la matière pour une autre professionnalisation. La production maraîchère, particulièrement, les cultures de contre saison (pendant les saisons sèches) sont très rentables car en cette période les produits sont presque inexistants sur les marchés et ceux qui en font, en tirent beaucoup de profits. Pour cela, il faut disposer de motopompe, ce que Monsieur T. ne dispose pas malheureusement. Ce qui limite sa production et ses revenus pouvant permettre de sortir sa famille de la pauvreté et de la misère. Pour augmenter la taille de sa production et en tirer beaucoup de profits, Monsieur T. a besoin d’un crédit de $700 pour acquérir une motopompe et des intrants. Il dispose de plusieurs atouts dont le lac Togo qui traverse son village.

loans.use: Motor pomp and fertilizers purchase

loans.name: Adakou

texts.en:
Madam Adakou A. is 43 years old. Today, she is a widower and with six (06) children at her charges. This big responsibility recommends her to undertake income generative activities in order to be able to provide for her childrens needs: feedings, health cares, education. That is how she is launched in the fire wood trade with the modest amount of $ 55 which she had at her disposal. This activity consists concretely to travel to the villages to buy fire wood and in return to sell it at Kpémé where she is living and where the wood is very rare, especially for the kitchen. Madam A. does not succeeding to satisfy all her customers because she hasn’t enough fund to make a permanent storage of fire wood. She tries sometimes to refer to the usurers, who destroyed her more for the interest rates are high, more than 300%. So, today, she needs $ 450 to constitute a working capital for the supplying, the fire wood transportation and storage to increase her activities and to improve her family living conditions.

Madame A. Adakou âgée de 43 ans. Aujourd’hui, elle est une veuve et a à sa charge six (06) enfants. Cette grande responsabilité lui recommande d’entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants : alimentations, soins de santé, scolarisation… C’est ainsi qu’elle se lança dans le commerce du bois de chauffe avec la modeste somme de $55 qu’elle disposait. Cette activité consiste en pratique à aller dans les villages pour acheter du bois de chauffe et venir le revendre à Kpémé où elle réside et où le bois se fait très rare, surtout pour la cuisine. Madame A. n’arrive pas à satisfaire tous les clients parce qu’elle ne dispose pas d’un capital suffisant pour faire un stock permanent de bois de chauffe. Elle tente parfois de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui l’a ruiné davantage car les taux d’intérêt sont exorbitants, plus de 300%. Elle a donc besoin aujourd’hui d’un crédit de $ 450 pour constituer un fond de commerce pour l’approvisionnement, le transport et le stockage du bois de chauffe pour augmenter ses activités et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Fire woods supplying,transportation and storage

loans.name: Diane Awan

texts.en:
Born from a numerous and very poor family, Miss Diane Awan A. (Diana) has succeeded to attend the primary and secondary school in the very difficult conditions. Obliged to give up early her studies for lack of support, Miss Diana has successfully completed her training in the modern kitchen (African, European and American meals). Unfortunately, she was unemployed after her training. Very laborious and without complexity, she started to cook and sell before the schools from the small financial support of $300 got from MICROFUND. With such good experience, Miss Diana wants to increase her activities by the opening of a small “Bar Restaurant” with traditional menus well appreciated nowadays. The project forecasts also the training on job of young girls in difficult situation. In the day time, she will serve the traditional meals and in the evenings, she will serve spaghettis, salads, tea or coffee, fried etc. This project, if it happens to be realized as forecast, will allow among others, to: - Be self employed and create jobs for three (03) young girls as salaried contributing thus to the jobless decrease - Serve the meals of quality but at less cost to the customers -Increase her incomes and improve her living conditions on the social, economic and financial plans in order to escape the circle of poverty. The credit of $850 requested will serve to rent one location and build a shed, acquire the kitchen materials and utensils to have consequent revolving funds at the size of the activity.

Né d’une famille nombreuse et très pauvre, Mlle Diane Awan A. a réussi à boucler les études primaires et secondaires dans des conditions assez difficiles. Obligée d’abandonner prématurément ses études par manque de support, Mlle Diane a réussi à se former en cuisine moderne (spécialités africaines, européennes et américaines). Malheureusement, elle s’est retrouvée en chômage après sa formation. Très élégante, laborieuse et sans complexe, elle a commencé par préparer au bord des rues et devant les écoles. Avec cette expérience réussie, Mlle Diane veut agrandir ses activités par l’ouverture d’un petit « Bar restaurant » aux menus traditionnels très bien appréciés actuellement au Togo. Le projet prévoit également la formation sur le tas des jeunes filles en situation difficile. Dans la journée, elle servira des repas traditionnels et les soirs, spaghettis, salades, thé ou café, frites, etc. La réalisation de ce projet, lui permettra, notamment d’augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie afin de sortir du cercle vicieux de la misère. Ceci est d’autant plus évident qu’elle évitera de s’exposer ou de se retrouver dans les mains des hommes peu scrupuleux avec VIH/SIDA qui sévit aujourd’hui. Le crédit de $850 sollicité servira à louer un petit emplacement ou local et acquérir les matériels et ustensiles de cuisine, disposer d’un fonds de roulement à la taille de l’activité.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and rent local
