loans.use: Miguel is applying for this loan so that he can purchase raw materials for his sandals, such as leather soles, straps, laminant, and glues.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Mrs. G. is widow and has 2 children. Her husband die 2 years ago, but she is a very optimistic person. She starts her own business, selling comforters, blankets, bed sheets, and pressure cookers. She offers her products in her house, because she has to take care of her children. \"Here in New Laredo, (Border City, Mexico-USA) the winter is very intense. She wants to give a very good price to her clients, on her products and wants to grow her business; “This will be without a doubt a good season” She said. She is asking for a loan of $950 to obtain its objective. She wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

La Sra. G. quedó viuda, no obstante ello es una persona muy optimista, se inició así en la venta de cobertores, sábanas y ollas de vapor; sus productos los ofrece en su casa pues debe cuidar de sus hijos. “Aquí en Nuevo Laredo (Ciudad fronteriza México-USA) el invierno es muy intenso, quiero dar buen precio a mis clientes con mis productos y quiero hacer crecer mi negocio; esta será sin duda una buena temporada!!” Solicita la Sra. G. un préstamo por $950.00 para lograr su objetivo, piensa pagarlos En un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
My name is Maria Antonia. I am a retailer of snacks and treats in the center of my community. The location has a lot of travellers everyday. I have been doing this for several years. I am able to pay for family expenses as well my children\'s education. Right now, I need to supply my business because sales increase in the holiday season.

Loan Use: Purchase of elotes, chicken, yucca, plantains, condiments, vegetables, flour, and butter

Mi Nombre es Maria Antonia, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, lugar que es muy transitado, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y de estudio de mis hijos, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que en esta temporada las ventas incrementan.

loans.use: Compra  de elotes, pollo, yuca,platanos, condimentos, verduras, harina,  manteca

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Mr. Calderon has more than 20 years of experience in his barber shop. His business is in his house, and in that way, he takes care of his mother. His mother is an older person and has an eye disease. Mr. Calderon is asking for a loan of 800.00 to renew his work equipment, this Includes cut hair machines, dryers, a washing hair system and other improvements of the commercial location. This will allow him to offer a better service to his clients and increase his income, and then he will be able to resolve his basic necessities and support the medical expenses of his mother.

Español

El Sr. C. tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en su peluquería. Su negocio está en su propia casa, y de esa manera cuida y apoya a su madre, quién es una persona de edad avanzada y que actualmente padece de una enfermedad de la vista. El Sr. C. solicita un crédito por 800.00 para renovar su equipo de trabajo, que incluye: maquinas para cortar cabello, secadoras, un sistema de lavado y otras mejoras que requiere su local. Esto le permitirá ofrecer otros servicios a sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias, con lo que podrá solventar sus necesidades básicas y los gastos médicos de su madre.

loans.use: renew equipment and improvement of commercial location

loans.name: Marina Antonia

texts.en:
My name is Maria Antonia and for over a year I have had a grocery store called Pulperia toñita in the center of my community. I am able to cover my expenses and pay my suppliers. At the moment, I need to supply my store to satisfy customer demand.

Loan Use: Purchase of sugar, butter, rice, beans, pastes, flour, refreshments, candies, churros and others.

Mi Nombre es Maria Antonia, cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi comunidad, operando bajo el nombre de Pulperia toñita, tengo un año de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y otros comprovisos a proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio para poder satifacer la demanda de cliente.

loans.use: Compra de azucar, manteca, arroz, frijoles, pastas, azucar, harina, desechables, refrescos, confites, churros   y otros.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
My name is Ramona P. and I have a grocery store located in the center of my neighborhood. I have been doing this for a few years and I earn enough to pay for family expenses and other commitments. This business also allows me to take care of my family because it is located in my house. Actually, I need to supply my business because it is already the Christmas season and sales increase.

Loan Use: Purchase butter, rice, sugar, corn, beans, meats and other supplies

Mi nombre el Ramona P., cuento con una pulperia ubicada en el centro de mi colonia, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, este negocio me permite atender a mi familia ya que esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la Navidad y las ventas aumenta.

loans.use: Compra de manteca, arroz, azucar, lactos, embutidos,maiz, rijoles, carnes y otros

loans.name: Blanca Norma

texts.en:
My name is Blanca Norma and I sell valeadas. My business is strategically located in my neighborhood. I hace been doing this type of work for several years. I am able to support my family with my business. I am a single mother and thankfully, this business allows me to support my family and educate my children.

Loan Use: Purchase of butter, flour, firewood, condiments, beans, and other supplies

Mi Nombre es Blanca Norma, cuento con un negocio de venta de valeadas, ubicado en un lagar estrategico de mi colonia, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares, ya que soy madre soltera y gracias este negocio puedo soster economicamente a mis hijos y darles educacion.

loans.use: Compra de Manteca, Harina, leña, condimentos, frijoles, lacteos y otros

loans.name: Juana Lorena

texts.en:
My name si Juana Lorena and I have a small steamstress shop in my home. I have a lot of experience and good customer base. Thankfully, this business allows me to take care of my family and contribute to family expenses and the education of my children. Right now, it is the Christmas season and I need greater investment in supplies to satisfy the needs of my clients.

Loan Use: Purchase of fabrics, buttons, zippers, threads, needles, clasps and other sewing supplies

Mi nobre es Juana Lorena, cuento con un pequeño taller de sastreria, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo mucha experiencia y buena clientela, gracias esta actividad puedo atender a mi familia y a la vez generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, ahora que se aproxima la Navidad necesito mayor inversion para poder satisacer la demanda.

loans.use: Compra de telas, botones, siperes, hilos, pelun, agujas,broches y otros

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Mrs.Emma Olivares has a beauty shop since 2003.

This is her only source of income, and is in her house.

Mrs. Emma take care of her parents, because they are older.

She decided to install her beauty shop in her house, because she wants to work in her business and take care of her parents.

Her business is in a popular neighborhood, that’s why she has to give a cheaper price on haircuts and sometimes this price is not enough to buy haircut equipment and give maintenance to the beauty shop.

Mrs. Emma is asking for a loan of $900.00 to buy haircut equipment and give maintenance to the beauty shop.

She wants to repay in 12 moths.

Español

La Sr. Emma Olivares C. tiene una estética desde hace 3 años.

Esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, la instalo en su casa.

La Sra. Emma cuida de sus padres, pues son adultos mayores por lo cual decidió poner el negocio en casa y así poder atender tambien a ellos.

Su negocio esta ubicado en un colonia de bajos recursos, por lo que el precio de corte de cabello tiene que ser bajo y en ocaciones esto no le permite comprar equipo para su estetica y darle mantenimiento del negocio.

La Sra. Emma solicita un préstamo de $900.00 para comprar equipo de corte de cabello y para darle mantenimiento a su negocio. el plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy equipment and improve commercial location

loans.name: Mildren Yolany

texts.en:
My name is Mildren and I have a business that sells fruit in all areas of my city. My husband and I have been doing this for several years. We earn enough to support our family and to educate our children. We have three children that are studying and thankfully, this business allow us to pay for their schooling. Soon it will be the Christmas season. We need to buy apples, pears and grapes. This is what we sell most in this season.

Loan Use: Purchase of grapes, apples, watermelon, papayas, pears, pineapple, oranges, bananas, coconuts and other fruits

Mi Nombre es Mildren cuento con un negocio de venta de frutas, los que distribuyo en todas la ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad junto con mi esposo, actividad que nos genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y de educacion de mis hijos, tenemos 3 hijos estudiando y gracias a este negocio podemos cubrir esos gastos, ahora que se aproxima la Navidad necesitamos comprar Manzana, peras y uvas ya que es lo que mas se vende en esta epoca.

loans.use: Compra d uvas, manzanas, sandias, papayas, peras, piña, naranjas, bananos,cocos y otros

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en:
My name is Yeni Altamirano. I have a business located in the center of my city. I have been selling goods made of plastic for several years. I earn enough to support my family and to pay my suppliers of plastic goods. At this time, I need to supply my business. Clients are asking for a greater variety of goods and I can serve them better this way.

Loan Use: Purchase of various plastic goods to sell

Mi nombre es Yeni Altamirano, tengo un negocio uicado en el centro de mi ciudad de venta de productos plasticos, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubri los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que los clientes solicitan variedad de productos y poder brindar un mejor servicio.

loans.use: Compra de pailas plasticas,valdes,Bajillas de cridrio, escobas, desechables,juguetas,bolsas y otros

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
For Mr.Eusebio and his wife Maria, The day begins at 3:00 am, they prepare tamales y atole (typical Mexican food), at 6:00 am, Mr. Eusebio goes to schools and crowd places to sell his products. Mr. Eusebio is a person who loves music, he said “Music is and will be the love of my life”. He sings to attract more clients. After he finishes the food sales, he goes to public places and buses to sing. Mr.Eusebio is asking for a loan of $850.00 to buy ingredients and renew his tricycle where he transports the food. This winter seems to be a good sales season for him. He plans to pay back in 12 months. Español

Para el Sr. Eusebio y su esposa María, el día empieza a las 3 de la mañana; preparan tamales y atole (comida y bebida típicas mexicanas) a las 6 de la mañana, el Sr. Eusebio se traslada a escuelas y lugares de afluencia de gente para vender sus productos; el es un apersona que ama la música “La música es y será el amor de mi vida” comenta Don Eusebio; pues como complemento toca la guitarra y canta para atraer a mas clientes. Después de la venta de alimentos se dedica a cantar en plazas públicas y transportes urbanos. Ya que está próximo el invierno, solicita apoyo por $ 850.00 para renovar el medio de trasporte en el cual se transporta el y sus alimentos, así como para adquirir materias primas pues en esta época se incrementa la demanda de sus productos. El Sr.Eusebio planea pagar en 12 meses.

loans.use: buy ingredients and a new tricycle.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
My nade is Maria del Carmen and I have had a small cafe in my house for a few years now. I am able to contribute to family expenses and the cost of educating my children. It is the Christmas season and sales increase. I need to supply my business.

Loan Use: Purchase of meats, softdrinks, orange juice, rice, sugar, butter, vegetables, condiments and other supplies.

Mi Nombre es Maria del Carmen cuento con un comerdor, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de estudio de mi familia, ya se aproxima la navidad y el volumente de venta es mayor, necesito abastecer mi negocio.

loans.use: Compra de carnes, lacteos, refrecos, jugo de naranjas, arroz, azucar, manteca, verduras, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. A. has 11 years working in her grocery store. Is her only source of income.

She takes care of her parents, they live, far away, in the south of México, and she send money to them.

In the future she wants to invite them to live with her. “I need to work very hard and save some money and then invite them to live with me”.

She is asking for a loan of $1200.00 to buy a freezer and sale dairy products and ham.

“I love my work, because, I talk with too many people and I share my smile with them.

Español

La Sra. A. tiene 11 años dedicada a la venta de abarrotes, siendo su única fuente de ingreso; sus padres viven al sur del País, muy lejos; con mucho esfuerzo les envía dinero y desea en un futuro traerlos a vivir con ella “Necesito trabajar muy duro y ahorrar para poder traerlos a vivir conmigo”. Solicita $ 1,200.00 de apoyo para la adquisición de un refrigerador para la venta de carnes frías y productos lácteos. “Me gusta mucho mi actividad pues convivo con la gente; siempre me gusta regalarles una sonrisa”

loans.use: buy a freezer

loans.name: Rosina Takyiwa

texts.en:
SHE PRODUCES FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FOR SALE IN THE LOCAL MARKETS, LOCAL EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS AND HEALTH CENTERS. THE TARGET CLIENTS INCLUDE SCHOOL CHILDREN, PATIENTS OF THE LOCAL HEALTH CENTERS, THE 5 SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES AT LARGE, AND 1 MAJOR URBAN CENTRE.

SHE HAS RECEIVED FARM BUSINESS SKILLS TRAINING BASED ON KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION\'S TEACH LENDING STRATEGY. THIS METHODOLOGY INVOLVES PROVIDING HER THE NEEDED SKILLS IN FARM BUSINESS RECORD KEEPING, DAILY SALES, PROFITS AND WORKING CAPITAL AND FARM PRODUCE MARKETING SKILLS.

SHE HAS ALSO ACQUIRED TRAINING IN FRUIT PROCESSING TO MAKE FRUIT JUICES TO SELL TO SCHOOL CHILDREN TO HELP IMPROVE THEIR DIETARY INTAKES TO ENABLE THEM TO BE IN SCHOOL.

loans.use: PURCHASE A SMALL FRUIT PROCESSING MACHINE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more motorcycles for boda-boda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on his restuarant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on stock

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile is a farmer in the rural Moldovan village of Gradiste, where he is an active community member and strives to be involved in organizations and projects which serve the agricultural sector. He is the director of the local milk-collection cooperative which enables the area’s 75 small milk producers to combine their output and sell it on the regional market. Vasile himself owns three cows and wants to buy a one more now to work towards his goal of seven animals, which will allow him to have a steadier supply of milk, both for his family and for sale. For this he needs a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Stefan

texts.en: The agriculture intensive southern region of Moldova has many small scale farmers, most of whom grow a number of crops using very traditional methods. Stefan, living in the town of Gradiste, is one of these farmers and fills his fields primarily with grains. His harvest is usually divided between the local farmer’s market and a deposit storage facility where he preserves the highest quality goods for the off-season. Stefan has recently turned to experimenting with higher quality seeds from Holland (especially for corn) and found a vastly improved yield. He would like to use such seeds exclusively for the next planting. Stefan is requesting a loan to buy seed stock and to cultivate his 4 hectare plot.

loans.use: Land cultivation and seed purchase

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria and her family have a small farm with modest but well-kept fields adjacent to their home in the village of Gradiste. Here they cultivate wheat and sunflowers, the latter being used for oil production. She travels to two of the surrounding regional markets to sell her goods. One of the keys to successful crops lies in preparation of the land, including cultivation and enrichment with new soil, compost, etc. Maria took care to follow all the appropriate steps and has seen good results, but does not have a the equipment to harvest the grain. She needs a loan to hire someone who owns a combine and can help her with the harvest.

loans.use: Grain harvesting services

loans.name: Eudochia

texts.en: Eudochia grows vegetables on her hillside land plot in the southern province of Cimislia. The mainstay of her farm lies in growing seedlings in a greenhouse and selling them at the local market. Together with her family of five she also grows potatoes and an assortment of vegetables in the open field, selling mostly to residents of her village  In the last year flooding and other harsh weather conditions severely diminished her harvest and Eudochia will need a loan to purchase seed potatoes, vegetable seeds and supplies for the next planting.

loans.use: Seeds and supplies

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en: Alexandra is a traditional farmer in a region of Moldova where agriculture is the occupation for most. She grows corn and a variety of vegetables in her fields and small greenhouse. Alexandra hopes to begin a new planting schedule and requires a loan to purchase seeds for what will be an early crop of vegetables, as well as for purchase of fuel to power the small irrigation system that is an essential part of ensuring a good crop.

loans.use: Seeds, fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on agriculture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on the stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: $1500 To Purchase a heater, supplies and products for her at home salon.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Dionicia has owned her breakfast restaurant for 2 years now, although she is by no means new to the restaurant business. She worked in a small eatery for 10 years, and her husband runs a small ice cream shop nearby. In fact, it was Dionicia’s husband who initially lent her the $100 she needed to get the bare essentials to open her very own restaurant. She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy rice, oil, dishes, and sugar. Ms. M. helps her husband in any way she can to advance his business, and he likewise. Their combined efforts have enabled them to own their home and send their kids to school elsewhere in Ecuador to get a better education. Their aspiration is to consolidate the breakfast restaurant and the ice cream store to offer their customers extra value.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to buy rice, oil, dishes, and sugar.

loans.name: Mirella

texts.en:
Mirella owns a small shop that primarily sells electronic household devices such as hairdryers, electric razors, as well as various clothing lines, and she has been in business for 5 years. Originally, Ms. Mejia opened her store with $50, buying sheets and household items. Gradually, from selling items to her neighbors and saving her profits Mirella was able to rent a small location nearby her house where she operates the business. Sometimes, her husband has to lend her some of his own earnings in order to finance Mirella’s growth, but there are obvious limits to that growth when he can only lend $10 at a time. She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase rice cookers, pots, and dishes. This is a critical time for such items since many families will be using these for Christmas celebrations. Ms. Mejia and her husband are a young but entrepreneurial couple; they are proud that they own their humble home and have saved enough money to send their children to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase rice cookers, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora has dedicated herself to selling cosmetics and perfumes. She sells a line of perfumes manufactured in Guayaquil called Yanbal. When Aurora’s husband had a hard time finding a job, she quit her job as full time mom and opened her shop, Cosméticos Esmeralda, in order to support the family. She is asking for this loan in order to increase the selection of perfumes for her customers, and being so close to Christmas, cologne and perfume is a popular thing to save up for and give as gifts. Nowadays, Aurora runs the show – the entire show. Her husband abandoned the family and left her in charge of their 5 children. Her wish is to be able to earn enough money from operating Cosmeticos Esmeralda so that she can cover the costs of living for herself and the remaining kids who still lives in the house.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is asking for this loan in order to increase the selection of perfumes for her customers, and being so close to Christmas, cologne and perfume is a popular thing to save up for and give as gifts.

loans.name: Jazmín

texts.en:
Jazmin owns a small restaurant in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has operated this small business for a year now, but she spent many years learning how to run a restaurant from her mother who was in the same line of work all of her life. Jazmin is asking for this loan so that she can buy raw materials and ingredients for her business such as rice, butter, flour eggs, and dishes. She is a single mother of four, and her restaurant is her only source of business. Ms. Sanchez wants lenders to know that she is extremely hard working and entrepreneurial, and her wish is to make the restaurant popular so she can earn enough to send her children to school.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: azmin is asking for this loan so that she can buy raw materials and ingredients for her business such as rice, butter, flour eggs, and dishes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has been selling platanos of all kinds for 20 years now. He learned the business from his father, and he knows the ins and outs of growing, harvesting, marketing, and selling his fruit. His wife helps him run the small store in Guayaquil, Ecuador when she isn’t working herself in the breakfast restaurant next door. Wilson is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase a larger inventory of platanos, or plantains, and yucca to offer in various markets. Wilson and his wife have two children who also lend a helping hand in the businesses. This unified family is focusing on improving its livelihood by working hard and gradually saving enough money to expand their business so it can accommodate hundreds of customers every day.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Wilson is applying for this loan through Kiva and Mifex in order to purchase a larger inventory of platanos, or plantains, and yucca to offer in various markets.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Mr. Rodríguez has 34 years dedicating to the car and truck repairs.

He likes his work very much.

He is applying for a loan of 1200.00 to buy electric equipment and tools.

His clients recommend him, and that’s why he has more clients.

He wants to expand his business and hire people, who needs to support their families. He would like to pay back in 12 months. Español

El Sr. Rodríguez tiene 34 años dedicándose a la reparación de autos y camiones. Disfruta mucho de su trabajo.

El Sr.Rodrigues solicita un crédito de 1,200 para comprar herramientas y equipo para reparar fallas eléctricas. A medida que más personas lo recomiendan, ha crecido el número de clientes que solicitan su servicio. El desea agrandar su taller y darle empleo a otras personas necesitadas para contribuir al desarrollo de otras familias. Está convencido que con un crédito podrá mejorar la economía de varias familias.

loans.use: buy tools

loans.name: Mariela

texts.en:
Mariela is a young woman and has 26 years old, she is a hard working and capable woman, she has one child and he is the most important thing in her life. She was studying but she could not work because her baby was born and she thought it was best to wait until the baby grew up. She wanted to have a business and at the same time take care of the baby. She started to sell lunch near her house and obtained good results and now her demand has increased. To day, she needs your help to buy the raw material like glasses, cups and more, in order to grow up her business, increase her sales and offer a better services to her clients.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 375 to purchase raw materials and she offers to repay in 4 months at least.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Mariela es suna mujer joven de 26 años de edad, muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es madre de un niño de dos años de edad que es el motor de su vida. Ella estaba estudiando y al terminar su carrera nació su hijo por ese motivo tuvo que esperar a que creciera un poco su hijo para poder poner su negocio y de esa forma poder ayudarse y salir adelante, generando ingresos que le permitieran sostenerse junto con su hijo. En Noviembre del 2005 se quedó sola y empezó a vender almuerzos a las maestras de una escuela cercana y tuvo muy buena aceptación, motivo por el cual se incrementó su demanda incluso a solicitarle comidas y licuados y desde entonces su negocio ha estado creciendo.

Hoy solicita un crédito por $ 375 USD el cual piensa destinar una parte para la compra de materias primas que utiliza en la elaboración de sus desayunos y comidas, y la otra parte la piensa destinar a la compra de utensilios como platos, vasos, tazas, etc. Los cuales le ayudaran a brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El plazo que requiere para pagarlo es de 4-8 meses.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is worried about her children’s education because she thinks it is the best thing to provide them. She is 35 years old, enthusiastic and hard working. She is married and her children are Karla and Gonzalo, 14 and 11 years old respectively.

Rosario thought \"how can I help my family?\" because her husband’s income is not enough to cover the family expenses, so she started her own business in order to offer a better education to her children. First she sold shoes, but that way was no good, so she started a small grocery store in her house. Now she has many clients in her neighborhood but needs working capital to finance the store\'s raw materials. She is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase merchandise and offers to repay in 5 months.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

La preocupación de Rosario es poder brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos, ella es una mujer de 35 años de edad, muy entusiasta y trabajadora, esta casada con Don Gonzalo R. y tienen dos hijos, Karla y Gonzalo de 14 y 11 años respectivamente.

Hace dos años decidió iniciar un negocio para de esa forma poder tener ingresos adicionales y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, ya que sus hijos estudian y ellos quieren que terminen una carrera y saben que con la educación hay muchos gastos que cubrir. Al principio empezó a vender zapatos como promotora en una zapatería pero no le fue muy bien y por eso decidió iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes en su casa, acondicionando la cocina de su casa que da al frente de la calle, para poder atender a las personas.

Actualmente cuenta con clientes que la prefieren por la cercanía de su negocio y es por eso que necesita de un crédito por $ 650 USD para abastecerse de mercancías y poder tener mejor surtido su negocio, el plazo que solicita para pagarlo es de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juanita is 38 years old, married with a technical electrician and mother of three children Jair, Christian and Miriam- she lives for her family. Juanita started a small business of renting video games and built in front of her house a small place to run the business along with a groceries store. Juanita wanted to have extra income to support her husband with the family expenses and support her children’s education. She also loves her children and wants to give them professional studies.

She is requesting a loan of $650 USD to purchase merchandise for her business and face the demand increase from the next discharge season of sales. She requires 5-10 months to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita es una mujer de 38 años muy trabajadora, ella esta casada y su esposo es técnico electricista, tienen tres hijos, Jair, Christian y Miriam, de 15, 14 y 10 años respectivamente.

Ella inició un pequeño negocio de renta de videojuegos y luego construyó un pequeño local en el frente de su casa para ir complementándolo con venta de abarrotes, la idea que tenía en mente era obtener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo para poder solventar los gastos del hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos, ya que quieren apoyarlos para que estudien una carrera profesional.

En estos momentos Juanita necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 USD para poder surtir de mercancías su negocio y de esa forma poder hacer frente al incremento en sus ventas que se da en la próxima temporada del año. El plazo que requiere para pagar es de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a blacksmith who makes gates, metal doors and windows. This is the second loan his is seeking from Kiva and Mifex. He was extremely satisfied with the results from the first loan in the amount of $300 received in May 2006. He invested in metal materials that allowed him to work much more quickly and efficiently. His repayments were on time and he proved to be a very responsible borrower. His family testifies to the success of the loan as they have seen a significant increase in income and improvement in their quality of life. Manuel is anxious to receive a larger loan so that he can scale his operation. He no longer wants to bring in clients just on references. His goal is to create a large inventory of his products to display in front of his home in order to attract new customers. He currently runs his operation in his backyard but his long-term goal is to open a workshop outside of his home.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in materials for his metal workshop

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a repeat borrower on Kiva who owns a bakery and a small market. During his first loan Vicente only sold bread, but the $300 loan helped him expand his business. He was able to buy the raw materials for his baking operation at greatly reduced prices. With the profits from his bakery he eagerly reinvested in his business. He purchased a new refrigerator, bought complimentary goods to sell and now has a full fledged market where he sells a wide variety of products including his fresh bread. He is reapplying for a second loan in order to buy ingredients for Pan de Pascua (Christmas bread) which is very popular during the holiday season. These ingredients include: flour, sugar, yeast, dried fruit and nuts. He will also continue investing in complementary products to sell at his market.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in ingredients to make Pan de Pascua (Christmas Bread) and purchase complementary products to sell as well

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel runs a small market with the help of his 3 children. This is the second loan he will receive from Kiva and Mifex. With his first loan he bought a great deal of products at wholesale prices for his store. With the profits he generated he decided to set up a small work station where he fixes radios and other appliances from the community.

He was very happy with the results of the loan and now is applying for a loan of $800. He plans to continue investing in wholesale goods and also wants to buy an arcade machine for the local kids. The machines are particularly cheap because a large arcade in the city has gone bankrupt and they are selling the machines at very low prices. He has noticed that the games are a hit with kids and is confident the machine will generate profit in the long run.

He is pictured with the youngest daughter of his three children and one of his infant grandkids.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in wholesale goods and possibly an arcade machine

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria owns a small restaurant in her local community. Her great food keeps helps her maintain her neighbors and locals as frequent customers. She is a repeat Kiva borrower who is now seeking to further invest in her restaurant. With her first loan she was able to buy larger amounts of food and improve the quality of the dishes she prepared. She also made small changes to her restaurant like increasing the amounts of tables and chairs. Now she wants to make many more cosmetic changes and continue investing in furniture. She also would like to keep buying her ingredients at wholesale prices.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve the appearance of her restaurant

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis owns a fruit stand in a local market. He sells all types of fruits including: watermelons oranges, papayas and mangoes. He has already taken a loan out from Kiva and Mifex before. The loan was of great help to Luis who was finally able to avoid buying from creditors and lending from loan sharks that were abusive. He felt very relieved to be able to invest his own money in the business and has seen a steady increase in profits. With the capital Luis was able to buy more diverse fruits at larger quantities. With this new loan he will continue to buy fruits for his store and keep his business growing.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Luis will buy a variety of fruits in bulk for his stand in a local market

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 28 years,married with two children.He lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.Adam sells kerosene in retail using a hand driven fuel pump .The pump draws kerosene from a tank dug on the ground.He has been in this business for more than five years.
   The pump has recently cause the problem of malfunction.Some parts need replacement,the pump is 18 years old.Adam is in need of USD 750 to buy replacement parts of the pump and add another storage tank.The storage tank will act as cushion for stockouts.Adam did not like to loose his customers he has built a long time relationship.
    Most people in the area uses kerosene as fuel for cooking and boiling drinking water.The area has no public water services,people depend on water from shallow dug wells.Waterborne deseases are common especially chorella and amoebic dysentery.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Akiba

texts.en: Akiba lives in Makangarawe Dar es Salaam.She is married and has four children.One is in primary school,another in secondary school and others are in kindergarten.Akiba owns a retail shop selling various consumable items.She has operated that shop for more than six years now.She recently realized that the profit margin has been declining with respect of increased number of competitors.In a plan to improve her profit margin Akiba has decided to start a wholesale shop.The new strategy need additional capital.From her own savings Akiba managed to finance 15% of the business plan.She is in need of additional capital of USD 1000 to implement her plan.She expects this strategy will enable her make more income so as she can meet her family requirements and pay school fees for her children.She has a dream of becoming a big wholeseller in her area.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Faidha

texts.en: Faidha lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.  She is married with two children. She keeps broilers and layers.  It is now a fifth year since she started this business.  She recently managed to get a tender to supply eggs and chicken meat to various restaurants in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.  From her own business she can not have enough eggs and chicken to supply these restaurants.  In order to keep her customers, Faidha buys these items from other poultry keepers and resells them to these restaurants.  She earns a small margin of profit.  She realized that if she could produce herself these items she could earn super profit. She is in need of USD 1000 to expand the business to meet the demand from the restaurants.  From the loan amount she will add a flock of chickens, expand chicken hut, add more trays and medicines for chickens especially in this rain season.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija runs a hairdressing salon.  The salon is located in a busy area of Lumo in Dar es Salaam.  She has two assistants in her business.  In regular days she attends fifteen to twenty customers, of which sometimes she has to make the customers wait while she go downstreet to fetch hairdressing materials.  The situation which is not desirable in business.  Competitors may take this problem as an advantage.  To curb such a problem she is in need of USD 400 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna lives in a suburb called Lumo, adjacent to the Dar es Salaam International Airport (DIA)  in Dar es Salaam.  She is neither married nor has a kid, but she supports a family of seven people including her parents.  She sells fried fish near her home.  She has been in this business for three years now.  Her business has been stagnant with unexpected improvement.  This has been contributed by poor capital base and the high cost of living the family demands.  She is planning to expand her business.  The expansion plan will demand extra stock of cooking oil and charcoal.  Also she will need a big display cage for offering fish for sale.  She is in need of USD 400 to make her plan work.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is married with one child.  She runs a retail shop near her residence selling different consumable items, especially food.  She lives in Vituka Dar es Salaam.  She is facing stiff competition from nearby shops.  Due to her weak capital base she is likely to face difficulties as she usually faced with stockouts.  To sustain these competitions she is in need of USD 400 to strengthen her working capital.  The amount will be used to add stock of some items especially those with high turnover.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tabitha wants to buy varieties of clothes she sells in her business

loans.name: Vanio

texts.en:
Vanio P. is 49 years old. He keeps a little motor tyre shop in Blagoevgrad. He has been in this kind of business for 12 years.

Vanio is a trained engineer. He had worked in an electronic factory in Blagoevgrad for 16 years but it went bankrupt and he had to find a new job. Then he started with tyre trading.

At the beginning he only exported tyres to Serbia, Macedonia and Greece but two years ago he opened this shop and now he works only in it with his son who helps him.

Blagoevgrad is situated in Pirin Mountain and the winter is hard. That is why Vanio P. needs to supply winter kind of tyres. His first supply is of 30 pairs of tyres and he needs this $ 1 200 loan to pay for it.

loans.use: To buy 30 pairs of winter tyres
